hosts.about: I type into a box and internet comes out the other end.

Laura and Grant—brother and sister—are writers, painters, designers and nature-enthusiasts. We are endlessly inspired by the beauty and the unique history of this place and want nothing more than to share it with like-minded creatives.

recent.comments: Enjoyed the cabin, highly recommend!  Would stay there again.

items.comments: Enjoyed the cabin, highly recommend!  Would stay there again.
Beautiful home! We sat at night on the front porch for hours looking at stars. In the day we traveled to historic sites and walked. Love the place and location!
Laura and Grant's home was absolutely amazing. Every single thing you could think of was provided, and the scenery was breathtaking. If you are thinking of booking this home, just do it!
Worth the money. We had a whole mesa we could hike on.

What a special place! Was the perfect place to be on my birthday and we loved every aspect of it. The landscape and the layout were so dreamy and we loved how private it was. Highly recommend and will definitely come back!

Absolutely beautiful place! Just like in pictures. Quite remote but only about 20 minutes drive from town. Easy to find. We didn’t manage to get there before dark at the first time and we still found it easily! I slept on the couch and was pretty comfy! Woke up every day to the best views. Would definitely recommend this Airbnb to anyone visiting Mesa Verde!
We loved our stay at the Cliff House, a truly gorgeous location and unique home. It was also the perfect launch pad for adventures in the area!

description.summary:
***Are your dates booked? See “Read more…”***

Stay on the flank of Sleeping Ute Mountain in historic McElmo Canyon just 40 minutes from Mesa Verde and 20 minutes from the town of Cortez. The Cliff House is built right into the red rock cliff wall of a private red rock canyon alcove with comfortable amenities, internet, nearby petroglyphs and sweeping views down canyon. A perfect place to base yourself for your next creative endeavor or for exploring in the wilds of the four corners.
description.space:
In addition to being built into sandstone rock, the Cliff House is landscaped with native species that bloom all summer. Around the corner from the house, in another rock alcove, is a little lawn. Enjoy comfortable porch seating with a stunning view.

We purposefully do not provide a TV and hope our space is a nature-inspired respite. That said, we also know you might want to get away and retreat to the Cliff House in order to do some work in-between exploring the Southwest. We have fast, broadband wireless internet with Eero WiFi. Stream music to our Apple HomePod with your iPhone or AirPlay-enabled device. We have a network extender for strong Verizon LTE service.

***Are your dates already booked?***
We know the availability of the Cliff House is quite limited right now. If you message us and let us know when you are looking to book we will do our best to get back to you pending a cancellation. However, we do not maintain an official waitlist—keep checking the calendar, it’s always up-to-date.

We also have another rental on our property. It is a brand new build—a loft space converted from an old barn workshop. Visit our Airbnb profile to check it out.
description.access: You will have access to our entire cabin home, carport, and a secluded yard inside a beautiful rock alcove on our property. The Ladder Alcove and lawn are a shared space with ourselves, our dog, and guests from our Workshop Loft, but in general it is a very private space.
description.notes:
A few notes to make sure this is the right place for you:

The property is located down a single-lane, dirt road. It is safe for passenger cars, but drive slowly and watch for critters wild and domestic. Part of the road goes through open range and you sometimes have to patiently wait for cows or horses to move aside (particularly in the winter months).

We are located in a desert, rural area. Expect wildlife on the property (insects, geckos, foxes, deer, marmots, bobcats, mountain lions, and other fun critters). While the house is weather-tight, insects can and do get into the cabin. If the presence of insects might cause you undue concern or discomfort, this might not be the spot for you.

If you have any questions, don’t hesitate to contact us before booking.

**We offer discounts on longer stays (starting at 5 nights)!**
description.neighborhood: Un-obstructed, sweeping views of Sleeping Ute Mountain and McElmo Canyon from the front porch. Beautiful red sandstone rock out-croppings on the property as well. Access hiking trails with a short drive down Road G to Sand Canyon, a public entrance to Canyons of the Ancients National Monument.
description.transit:
There is parking on-site for up to 2 cars. The road into the property is a dirt, single-lane county road, but is easily passable by passenger cars. Help us preserve the quiet nature of canyon life for ourselves and our neighbors. Please drive slowly and watch out for critters.

Please note that we cannot accommodate trailers or RVs because of the tight turning radius the road requires.
description.house_rules:
- No shoes in the house please!
- Quiet hours between 9:30pm and 7:30am (voices carry in the canyon)
- Please read the guidebook (on-site) with regard to rules for exploring outside, on the property.
- The property is located down a single-lane, dirt road. It is safe for passenger cars, but drive slowly and watch for critters.
- If you show up with more people than in your booking, you will be turned away.
- We are located in a desert, rural area. Expect wildlife on the property (insects, geckos, foxes, deer, marmots, bobcats, mountain lions and other fun critters).

hosts.about: Country boy at heart, I like small town living

recent.comments:
We loved how private the location was, and it was truly unique how it was built in a cave!  It was fantastic having two washers and dryers and the layout of the home was terrific. Excellent how close it was located to Goblin Valley, Moonscape Overlook, Lake Powell and Capitol Reef. 

The only improvements I would offer is that there needs to be some maintenance and updates done. Some of the kitchen cabinets were completely broken off and others hinges needed tightening. While tidy, the home could use a good deep clean.

items.comments:
We loved how private the location was, and it was truly unique how it was built in a cave!  It was fantastic having two washers and dryers and the layout of the home was terrific. Excellent how close it was located to Goblin Valley, Moonscape Overlook, Lake Powell and Capitol Reef. 

The only improvements I would offer is that there needs to be some maintenance and updates done. Some of the kitchen cabinets were completely broken off and others hinges needed tightening. While tidy, the home could use a good deep clean.

A home as unique as its surroundings. Each of the three roads out of Hanksville lead to a totally different, stunning landscape. And at the end of a long day outdoors, this is a special place for a big group to call home.
The location is beautiful and the house is very unique. Outside of some cleanliness issues (beyond the home owners control), we loved our stay! Definitely a location we would like to revisit!
It was amazing! We had so much fun playing night games in the dark, visiting lots of local places and restaurants, Atv tours. Everyone in Hanksville was so kind and we loved the small town feel.
Remote vacation! What a fun spot for our family! It was quiet and definitely private. We especially enjoyed being able to take our side-by-side right out the front door! We’ll definitely be back.
Our family had a great experience. Definitely recommend!

I picked this place because it was unique.  I brought my family with me and my nephews couldn't get over that we were inside a rock. They called it the rock house and loved it. Very peaceful place and clean!

description.summary: This beautiful home was built right inside an incredible, red rock CAVE!   It was built in the 1980's by a local cowboy named A.C. Ekker. His dream sprang to life as he blew holes into the cliff-side and began to build his dream home nuzzled inside. This exquisite home was recently remodeled and has become the premier vacation spot in Hanksville.  Staying in this home is truly an experience all it's own.
description.space:
On the main level you will find the master king suite with exposed red rock and a huge garden top nestled into a red rock cave.  The kitchen is huge with everything you will need for your group to enjoy meals together.  It boasts a double oven and large refrigerator. The main living room has two full sized pull out sofa sleepers and large couch, along with blow up mattresses and plenty of bedding.  There is a full bathroom right off the main living room area. 
 Upstairs is a single queen room, full bathroom and a bedroom with three twin beds.  A full laundry room with washer and dryer are also available for guest use.
Recently remodeled, this beautiful home offers plenty of space for family reunions, hunting base camp, Utah adventure base camp, scout groups, youth groups, and much much more. With rich history and plenty of stories about the surrounding area, this home is perfect for your next excursion, vacation, or event.  In addition to the ample amount of space for your group, you can also pitch tents or bring travel trailers/motor homes.
description.access: Guests will have access to the entire home, aside from some storage spaces.
description.neighborhood:
The home is located on a remote section of land outside of Hanksville; it is surrounded by beautiful landscapes and plenty to enjoy. 
Inside Hanksville, you can find several delicious restaurants to eat at. Stan's Burger Shak, Blondie's, and Duke's Slickrock Grill all boast delicious menus and fantastic customer service. There are several gas stations as well; Stan's Silver Eagle has a large gift shop and plenty to choose from. The Hollow Mountain is a unique station nuzzled inside a mound of earth on the junction of Highway 24 and 95.

Hanksville acts as a base for many people enjoying excursions and exploring Southeastern Utah. We are close to many beautiful places to explore!

description.transit: There is plenty of parking space on the property. You will have to use your own vehicles for transportation.
description.interaction: We are not located on the property, but you may contact us through the Airbnb app with any questions or concerns you may have.
description.house_rules:
Thank you for choosing “The Dollhouse Ranch”
Please update your number of guests in the app to reflect the actual number that will be staying in our home.


	HOUSE RULES
1-	The road to the dollhouse is 1.5 miles on a dirt road. Any  car can make it, you do not need 4 wheel drive, unless it is raining heavily, then the road may be impassable.  If this is the case, we will arrange to get you in and out of the Dollhouse.
2-	We are constantly working on the Dollhouse ranch house and its surroundings. We will do our very best not to disturb you while you are staying with us.
3-	If you find something not working or just not right, please contact us and we will remedy the problem as quickly as possible.
4-	Please remove your shoes when entering the home, this home is in the “country” and wearing shoes in the home tracks mud throughout and makes clean up very difficult.
5-	Please keep food and drinks in the kitchen, dining area, and outside
6-	Please do not remove any of the furniture to outside or rearrange the furniture.  There are plastic tables and chairs in the master bathroom closet that can be used on the front porch.  Please clean and return them when finished.
7-	Please do not work on any projects inside the home, there is plenty of space outside to work on “things”
8-	The dollhouse ranch is just what it says it is, it is a ranch. There may be farming or construction equipment operating, please give right of way to them.
9-	The cliffs that surround the dollhouse are natural and are dangerous.  Please be careful around them, climbing or rappelling  is not allowed on this property.
10-	The washer and dryer are for your convenience, please use them as you need.  The laundry soap is free to use.
11-	Check in time is after 4 pm. If the home happens to be  available earlier, you may check in when it is available, but please do not plan on it.
12-	Check out time is at 10 am. IPlease check out on time as we need to prepare for the next guests.  Late checkout is billed at $50/hour.
13-	CHECK OUT PROCESS:
		1: Make sure dishes you used are washed and returned.
		2: Take out trash. Trash cans are near the gate entering the ranch
		3: Check unit for personal belongings.
		4: Leave all towels in a pile in each bathroom
		5: Strip sheets and pillowcases from beds.
		6: Return any roll-away beds to the closet.
		7: Close door tightly and lock.
When you exit, you are expected to leave the home in good repair, with dishes done, and all trash removed. Please note that anything that needs attention outside of what can be done during a routine cleaning will be charged at the rate of $50/hour (grease spills on blankets, carpet stains,
upholstery soiling, torn curtains) are charged for replacement costs.


14-	The garage is locked and is being renovated, no access is permitted.
15-	The dollhouse ranch is located in “the middle of everywhere”  if you need recommendations of hikes, canyoneering, atv riding, motorcycle riding, boating, or any other activity, we will give you some recommendations. 
16-	The Dollhouse Ranch is a good base camp to access all of the beautiful area and activities associated with them
17-	Atv riding on the dollhouse property is allowed. Please stay on the roads to get to other areas where you may ride at your will.
18-	There is a public gun range just around the bend from the front gate of the Ranch.
19-	Parking is allowed anywhere in front of the house, parking under the porch is not allowed.
20-	Smoking is not allowed in the home
21-	Pets are not allowed in the home
22-	If you have horses you may keep them in the arena area



NO SMOKING
THE UTAH CLEAN AIR ACT PROHIBITS SMOKING WITHIN 25 FT OF THE BUILDING. 
Smoke only 50 feet from the home.
Smoking in the home will result in a $500 dollar charge
					

Directions to “the dollhouse ranch”
From the junction of highway 95 and 24 travel west on hwy 24 for 1.6 miles. Turn right on the first road past the bridge.  The road is dirt from here, there is a brown blm road marker as you start on this road, it is marked 0109.  Travel on this road for 1.2 miles. At the bottom of the hill turn right, go through the gate and travel on this road for .3 miles to “the dollhouse ranch”

Your keycode to get in the front door is  ———- Please pull the door tightly closed if you have trouble operating the lock
Please feel free to call with any questions or problems  435-691-1369

description.summary: In the tranquil scenery of Mozaga in the center of Lanzarote, the intimate Finca Isabel is perfect for a romantic vacation getaway with access to a gorgeous shared pool area. The Estudio Marina, in an independent area of the larger estate, is a great holiday destination for those who want to explore the island with convenience but with all the comforts of home.
description.notes:
It is a rustic but modern space, with volcanic rock walls that can accommodate 2 adults and consists of a charming living room, a well-equipped kitchen with a dining room, a bedroom area with a double bed, one bathroom and the terrace.  Additional amenities include Wi-Fi, a fan, satellite TV, an electric heater, and a hair dryer. This beautiful studio also has a highchair, cot and a bed for children. The space can therefore accommodate two adults accompanied by a baby and a child under 12 years. 
The outdoor space invites guests to enjoy a glass of wine or to share barbecued dinners during the colourful sunsets. However, the highlight of the accommodation is the impressive pool area: guests descend into a beautiful natural volcanic landscape, with rock and lava walls that houses a shared pool of crystal clear water with a fountain and massage jets. Guests can sunbathe in the hammocks immersed in this impressive volcanic grotto, or rest in the shade of the cave with a refreshing drink. A supermarket - open seven days a week - is only 400m or 5 minutes walk from the property, while a large selection of shops, restaurants, bars and cafes is 7 minutes drive 3.5 km in the centre of San Bartolomé.  The fine golden sand of Reducto beach is 13 minutes by car or 11 km to the east. And to the west, 20 minutes by car, is Famara Beach - perfect for lovers of surfing, kitesurfing or those who want to lose themselves in breathtaking nature.

Parking spaces are available on the property. Bed linen and towels are included in the price. An extra bed for children under 12 years of age or a cot must be requested at the time of booking at no extra cost.
The swimming pool is shared between 3 studios and 2 apartments.
description.house_rules:
Please keep in mind that you will be requested to submit both your arrival data (passport data, flight data, contact information) after booking so that the homeowner can plan your stay and check-in accordingly.
Possible extra fees specified in the description need to be paid on site.

gallery.caption: outdoor kitchen in a separate building

This pic from above shows how close the rentals are to each other. There are three rentals: cabin, Hobbithenge and Dome.  All three are out of sight from each other and out of earshot. Dome guests walk by Hobbithenge but the windows are tinted.

hosts.about: I'm into wilderness, dance, science, archaeology, independent travel, lucid dreaming, Burning Man, yoga, tantra,  sustainability, ecology, shamanism, healing trauma, mysticism.

recent.comments:
I definitely paid for the experience more than anything! It was beautiful! I was very worried and a little upset we were gonna get hit with a bad thunderstorm, luckily we only got some rain and came somewhat prepared. The Hobithedge is a little warm given that it’s in the ground, but motherwood had a small fan that helped circulate the air. The other rentals didn’t bother me at all and and the outhouse was clean and within a very very short distance from the home. The kitchen however is a little further and would be very difficult to get to in the rain. 
All in all I really enjoyed my stay and would love to come back in when it’s a smidge cooler. I thought the wild flowers were beautiful and enjoyed the blackberries and all the amazing things that this world has to offer us (like the hundreds of lightning bugs at and after sunset!!). Definitely worth a night or two stay and would recommend it to anyone who enjoys the piece and quiet outside the societal norm.

items.comments:
I definitely paid for the experience more than anything! It was beautiful! I was very worried and a little upset we were gonna get hit with a bad thunderstorm, luckily we only got some rain and came somewhat prepared. The Hobithedge is a little warm given that it’s in the ground, but motherwood had a small fan that helped circulate the air. The other rentals didn’t bother me at all and and the outhouse was clean and within a very very short distance from the home. The kitchen however is a little further and would be very difficult to get to in the rain. 
All in all I really enjoyed my stay and would love to come back in when it’s a smidge cooler. I thought the wild flowers were beautiful and enjoyed the blackberries and all the amazing things that this world has to offer us (like the hundreds of lightning bugs at and after sunset!!). Definitely worth a night or two stay and would recommend it to anyone who enjoys the piece and quiet outside the societal norm.
Beautiful little place to stay!
This place is so magical. The whole field lit up with fireflies at night, it was so peaceful. Loved it. 10/10 🫶🏼
Great, Enjoyed

This magical place is exactly like the photos! I took my 16 year old niece for a special night and she thought it was just spectacular too. It’s a very unique property. Was everything we hoped  it would be.  Wish we would have brought a telescope, the sky is huge in the field.
Stayed here as a surprise for my husbands birthday - an avid lord of the rings fan. He absolutely loved it. We have just the night we needed - private, peaceful, and in a fun little hobbit house!
Absolutely beautiful home and kitchen, perfect for a weekend in the mountains.

description.summary:
It's stunning and unique.   It's a hobbit house built into the hill, crafted by hand from materials all on the land.   Though it's small,  it feels spacious.  The front pillars look like Stonehenge, hence the name HobbitHenge.  It's nestled into a meadow in wild nature with an astonishing view, yet it's only 25 minutes from Asheville. 

There are two other listings on the property.
description.space:
There is no other house like this.  Handcrafted out of clay and wood from the land, with jewels of stained glass and sculpture, it's the most grounding space I’ve ever felt.  You're nestled into the land, but you can see the stars.  It’s so quiet in there, it’s like being inside a snowdrift.  It’s the ideal space for meditation and healing.  Almost nothing came new from the store;  it’s all local clay and wood.  The view is amazing. 

We have a brand new caretaker who loves to clean!

However, this isn't for everyone.  When it's cold out, it's chilly inside. There is a gas heater which does ok, and you need to walk to the outhouse. Expect a long page of instructions to read and follow, for this adventure. It's RUSTIC -- a  mud house with dust and spiders.  The shower HAS ONLY COLD WATER AND MINIMAL PRIVACY!     If you have high standards for cleanliness this may not be for you!

Many people ask about privacy, so please see the picture from above to get an idea how close the other structures are. The other two rentals are out of sight and earshot, over the hills.

We have fast WIFI now.

 The guests for the dome walk past the hobbit house to get to their dome, but they can't see in the window, and their rental is out of sight an hearing of this one.

That being said, if you love nature and funky bohemian spaces, it's one of a kind..  It’s so quiet, wild, and peaceful here.  The mountain view is breathtaking, and it changes every moment.  The cacophony of owls, nighthawks, coyotes!  This cove is considered one of the most biodiverse regions in the country.  The sunsets go on for hours, the stars are amazing.  

There’s a wood stove, a gas heater, a desk, a loveseat and a queen bed in the loft. We now have screens on the door and windows, and battery fans, so you should be able to stay cool.  There's solar power for the lights and outlets.  There’s a beautiful kitchen very close by, which has electricity and stays dry but is not fully enclosed.  It's an outdoor kitchen so it's not sparkling clean. There is a sink for you to wash, and outdoor shower -- cold water only.

 Towels are not provided, but sheets and comforters are, and two pillows.
description.access: The beautiful kitchen, indoor/outdoor but dry with power and a place to sit, is a minute away.  The cold shower is there too.  The outhouse is a 2 minute walk away.
description.neighborhood: Gorgeous wild cove a short drive from Asheville.
description.transit: You need a car.
description.interaction: Text me with any needs.
description.house_rules:
Smoking outside.
This is a nature sanctuary so please no shouting or blasting music.  Please read the instructions we send you till the end.

recent.comments: The experience was wonderful. The cave is rustic, clean and amazing

items.comments: The experience was wonderful. The cave is rustic, clean and amazing
Great hosts! Amazing views!

Amazing cave house, gorgeously constructed and simply breathtaking piece of history.  Everyone in BIsbee knows about it (fun to hear them tell their stories connected to it while going in their shops and restaurants).  We love caves (the ladder tour at Colossal Cave in Vail is our favorite, love Mammoth Cave in Kentucky too), and incredible to literally “live” and sleep in one for a day/night.  Waterfalls and trails are amazing. Took both lightning and Milky Way photos at different times during the night (amazing views), and super fun when the power went out during the stunning lightning storm!  Almost total darkness inside the cave at that point — felt like we were “spelunking.”  Loved every minute. You won’t regret staying here.  Wanted the hot tub to work, except the people in town told us that it’s an on-going project. Five star experience!

description.summary:
This Amazing and unique property is located just outside historic Bisbee AZ, nestled in the Mule Mountains. Sitting at 5, 300 feet, it's surrounded by 37 acres of  plants, trees, natural pools, and seasonal waterfalls. Home is 3,000 sq ft,  with a calm and inviting atmosphere. The cave has a constant year round temperature of 68 to 70 degrees. Built in 1985, it took 15 years to complete. 
Front door opens to a beautiful sunroom, built around the entrance, that doubles as a bedroom.

A fantastic home carved into the mountain. A labor of love that took 17 years to create.

hosts.about: We are a young family business that love traveling, discovering new places, trying local food and learning about each place history and traditions. We also enjoy very much receiving guests from all over the world in our homes.  We value a lot the relationships and the experiences  that are build during both hosting and traveling and consider that is a great way to develop oneself. We try to make our guests feel as comfortable as possible and help them  in any way to make their holiday a great relaxation and fun experience.

une expérience privilégiée dans un lieu unique.

This is one of the most special Airbnbs! The view is incredible, and the bedroom caves just beautiful. The kitchen is well stocked, and eating on the terrace is so peaceful. 
Anaga is an amazing region and while staying at El Batan you're right in the middle of it. Would definitely want to come back!

Wat een heerlijke dagen hebben wij hier gehad met ons gezin op deze fantastische locatie! Ook dit is Tenerife, dus niet alleen dat super toeristische gedeelte. En wat een uitzicht! De trappen, hoewel het meer een steil rotspad is, is met koffers nog even een klim, maar prima te doen. Ook zit je hier met de auto zo'n half uur van de bewoonde wereld af, maar goed, dan heb je wel een prachtige plek. En supermooi appartement met heerlijke bedden!
Super place, I will come again next year!

The location is very tranquil and sitting out on the terrace is a special way to start or finish the day. 

The rooms are furnished comfortably and well equipped. I love an outdoor shower, and we enjoyed the bbq and eating outside under the shady canopy. 

Bar Mi Pueblo is a friendly place to grab a beer or local food when it's open Friday to Sunday.

We were incredibly lucky to be staying during the fiesta, which brought singing and dancing to the valley. 

Other reviews mention the smell of the septic tank and hot nights. 

We stayed during a heatwave and found that sleeping with the windows or doors open dispelled the stuffyness. I don't know if this is recommended, but there were no insects to speak of, and the lizards didn't come in (as far as we know!). We only noticed bad smells occasionally. 

We had a wonderful holiday. We felt both at home and far away. 

Ana, the host, who was very communicative, sometimes pre-emptively, for example to advise us about the fiesta.

The place is peaceful, but a few things detracted from the experience:
1. Super difficult to sleep: very very hot inside the caves (bedroom), we measured 26oC and you don't want to open the window as there's a resident mice pooping in the whole area of the property and could get in while we sleep
2. We asked for a fan weeks in advance and were told it wouldn't be needed, not true! We checked in and asked for one again and the host never solved. Kitchen was around 40oC!
3. terrible sewage smell
4. Got poisoned: house is far from any grocery and they inform you will have basic amenities including olive oil. They had the audacity to serve highly processed sunflower oil with antifoaming agents inside the refill olive oil bottle. One of us has severe allergies to seed oils and got a bad reaction. The host, acted confrontational and insensitive and never asked if we were ok. We had to beg for a solution!
5. checkout isn't flexible as promised in the listing & messages (vingative host?)

description.summary: We are happy to share with you our unique cave home located in the heart of Anaga Rural Park, awarded in 2015 as UNESCO Biosfere Reserve.  The settlement is divided in 4 caves that serve as 3 double bedrooms and a living room with sofa bed wich allows 8 people sleeping in total. Kitchen is fully equipped and you can also enjoy the BBQ and terrace with amazing views. The infrared sauna is absolutely great after a day spent in nature since we are in the heart of  well knowed hiking trails.
description.space:
It was during an inspiring hike from Cruz del Carmen towards Punta del Hidalgo when we discovered delightful El Batan, a quiet village that won our hearts instantly. So, when we found out that, right next to the hiking trail, there was a property for sale, we knew it would be ours. 

The friendly 93-year old Señor Isidro, who perfectly carved the charming caves with his own hands, happily sold us what used to be his place of wine production and storage. The proof of our house's past comes as a restored antique wine press handmade by the previous owner, which is now welcoming you right at the front gate. 

We renovated the house and arranged its incredible gardens with great love, without stealing its natural charm away, and we are now happily sharing it with nature lovers from all over the world. Beautifully decorated and fully equipped, our warm house offers you the comfort you deserve, paired with the breathtaking views you will love. 

You have 3 cozy double bedrooms with heating and humidity control system, and one beautiful living room that welcomes you with a small, but cool wine cellar, as well as a comfortable sofa bed and a TV. Also, you can enjoy preparing a tasty meal in the fully equipped kitchen with mesmerizing views, and you have 2 bathrooms with hot water and heating.

To take advantage of the gorgeous landscapes and fresh air, we created a lovely BBQ area, and for the sunniest days, the top terrace solarium is waiting for you with comfy sunbeams and an outdoor shower. And, of course, for a well-deserved pampering, enjoy the relaxing infrared sauna. 

The toiletry, bed linings, personal and beach towels, as well as bathrobes, are included, and we also welcome you with complimentary water, coffee, and tea, as well as main spices, olive oil and vinegar. You are also very welcome to indulge in our wine selection, displayed in the living room, with the option of paying at the property. The wine menu is rich and specially created for our guests.
description.access:
Besides the beautifully designed house and its relaxing areas, the property is also blessed with surrounding gardens filled with fig-trees, avocado, oranges, potatoes, and other gorgeous plants, depending on the season. 

There is also a relaxing picnic area next to the property, called La Fuente, meaning The Source, where hikers stop to rest, admire the views, and enjoy the water spring that offers freshwater all year round. 
The access to the place, from the parking, is on foot and you need to climb around 50 stairs. We, together with the people who already stayed at our cave home, assure you the effort is worth it. Once you decide you want to spend your holiday in our piece of heaven, we will send you all the necessary directions to easily reach the delightful cave home.
description.notes: The walk is very relaxing, but it can be a bit tiring with big items of luggage. We suggest a backpack instead of trolley luggage bags, but in any case, once you reach the destination, the effort will be instantly forgotten, leaving room for the pure joy given by the home-like space and the mesmerizing views.
description.neighborhood:
With sharp peaks, narrow gorges, and mesmerizing carpets of laurel trees, the Anaga Rural Park is a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve since 2015 and a real hikers’ paradise, welcoming all nature lovers looking for beauty and peace of mind. 


El Batan instantly impresses through its simplicity and beauty. The tranquil village is also home to a cozy restaurant, where you can enjoy home-cooked dishes, a charming parish, and a small plaza overlooking the Anaga Park.
description.transit:
Located on the northern slope of the Anaga massif, about 45 minutes (23 km) from the Tenerife North Airport and 90 minutes (78 km ) from the Tenerife South Airport, charming El Batan is formed of Batan de Arriba, Batan de Abajo, and Casas Heleras or de Lera. In the latter, you will find the parish of Our Lady of Candelaria, a charming public square, a sports field and the cozy Bar Mi Pueblo restaurant. 

If driving is not your cup of tea, you can also reach our beautiful cave house by bus. Take 274 from the main station in La Laguna ( Intercambiador de La Laguna) and enjoy a charming 40 minutes ride through lovely Las Canteras and Las Mercedes. 

Once you reach El Batan, please park your car in the parking space located right before Bar Mi Pueblo and get ready for an easy trek up the hill, towards your home for the next few days.
With Bar Mi Pueblo on your right and the bus station on your left, walk a few steps of some of the most beautiful treks in Anaga, towards Punta del Hidalgo and Cruz del Carmen. Pas the church and public square you will see on your right and continue on the small, stair-looking alley that takes you slightly left, towards our charming cave house. 
Every time you stop for a breath of fresh air, take advantage of admiring the views, but also the beauty of the trail, which is covered in green beauty. Pass by the picnic area, favored by hikers because of the views and the refreshing water spring and continue until you see our charming little cave house on your left. It will welcome you with a gorgeous, restored antique wine press handmade by the previous owner, located right at the main gate.
description.interaction: We are happy to answer any questions you might have regarding our place and the area.

Die Zeit bei Jeroen und Coco in der Höhle war unglaublich und wunderschön. Die beiden sind super herzlich und diskret. Alles ist sehr sauber und es bleiben keine Wünsche offen. Es war die schönste Reiseunterkunft in der wir bislang waren. Die Lage und der Ausblick sind traumhaft. Von der Unterkunft aus kann man perfekt zu verschiedenen Ausflügen auf der Insel starten und sie ist mit dem Auto super vom Flughafen aus zu erreichen. Man kann abschalten und zur Ruhe kommen und ist hinterher sehr erholt. Wir kommen auf jeden Fall wieder! Danke, liebe Coco und lieber Jeroen für die unvergessliche Zeit bei euch!

La grotte est très agréable, très jolie, réalisée et décorée avec goût, très propre et fonctionnelle. On s’y sent très bien, nous avons même eu une petite tempête avec d’importantes rafales de vent et de la pluie et nous nous sommes sentis en sécurité dans ce cocon.
L’emplacement est en plus très pratique pour se déplacer dans toute l’île.
Nous avons adoré partager ce logement avec les geckos qui y vivent !

FANTASTISCH!!! Die Lage, die Höhle, die Aussicht & der herzliche Empfang von Coco - alles war perfekt ! Diese einzigartige Unterkunft sucht Ihresgleichen. Sehr gerne kommen wir wieder, vielleicht klappt es im Januar 2024. Und: Danke Coco für den feinen Schokokuchen :-))
Een prachtige plek met fantastisch uitzicht. Jeroen en Coco hebben er iets prachtigs en compleets van gemaakt. Wij hebben genoten!

This was our best Airbnb experience and accommodation we've had so far. It's breathtaking what Jeroen and Coco have build here on a cliff out of a cave in just one year. I'm so impressed. I was a bit scared before our arrival, that there could be scary insects... Spiders or anything else, because its nature...but it was fine, no spiders. The geckos eat them. But we've had 2 cockroaches unfortunately. But we managed it. Luckily there are nets around the beds and I have to keep in mind that it's in the middle of nature. Coco was very welcoming and greeted us, she also vave us selfmade papaya bread after our check out which was so delicious. It was easy to find, and we also managed the stairs with big baggage. Nice training :-) We would love to come back and book again some day. The only thing, I think some of the outside furniture could get some more care.

Thank you for having us. It was perfect. I would have give more than 5 stars if I could.

I-N-C-R-E-D-I-B-L-E.  I would have stayed forever and only wish I could.  We had such a wonderful time at the absolute masterpiece that is "The Cave House" (and Jeroen & Coco made every effort to ensure that we did). We couldn't have wished for more kind and helpful hosts or a more fabulous setting for our adventure in La Palma.  I've never felt so sad to leave an Air BnB.  The cave is equipped with absolutely everything you could want;  particularly in the context of cooking and barbecuing but also helpful additions in the context of outdoorsy equipment, hiking gear, DVD collection, games etc.  Car recommended and the steps to get up and down to the cave are now joke.  It is hard to leave the cave (in more ways the one). Thank you, thank you J&C for everything.  We can't wait to come back.

description.summary: This unique cave house on the island of La Palma is situated on a cliff at just 200 metres overlooking the Atlantic and the bay of Santa Cruz. A true gem and wonder of nature, where the world is literally at your feet. For the adventurous, romantics and seekers of peace & quiet.
description.space:
We have respected the original lines in the design of the cave house and have used natural and recycled materials for the construction. That way you can have both the unique experience of cave living and the luxury of a modern house. 
Outside there are multiple terraces where you can sit in the sun under the grapevines, in the shadow of the avocado tree or in the hammock overlooking the ocean bay. Except for the observations of a group of dolphins at daytime through the giant binoculars that are present, or the weird sounds of the shearwater birds in the evening, nobody will disturb you here. The cave is a well kept secret for those wanting to write a masterpiece, watch every film-classic that is available in the TV/music-room. Or just be in the moment and enjoy the peace and quiet. 
If you wonder why every guest only can utter that one word: WOW! when visiting this grand ocean front cave house, you (and your beloved ones) must visit it yourselfs and have that unique experience.
description.access: The whole location in and around the cave house is out of sight and ear, and exclusive for guests.
description.notes:
Owing to its spectacular position on the cliff, the cave house can only be reached by way of 60 meters of steps. So you have to be fit, especially if you bring lots of luggage.
Furthermore, the cave-house is designed, technically equipped and suited best for two adults (and if the occasion rises also with one child). Because of the cave’s somewhat irregular shape the sleeping place on the mezzanine is only suitable for teenagers aged 10 or older (or one adult per level).
description.neighborhood: The location on the east of the island is 10 minutes away from the beautiful capitol Santa Cruz de la Palma. Just 10 minutes down the road form the entrance you find 3 secluded little beaches (that have showers), and the most impressive beach of the island Playa Nogales as well. Numerous other famous spots are within reach, such as the subtropical Los Tilos forest, and one of the islands' prettiest villages San Andres.
description.transit: It is strongly advisable to rent a car to be able to travel around the island. But the bus service on La Palma is pretty well organised. A bus-stop with an hourly service that can take you either to the capitol of Santa Cruz (and further) or in Northern directions, is at just 400m walking distance. But beware there are no shops in walking distance, and the bus service will take a lot of time and not reach all the special spots on the island.
description.interaction: The cave and its terrains have a private parking space and private entrance for the guests. The steps to the cave are also a private path on the edge of our terrain. If you need anything, we (or our housekeeper) are here to welcome you and help you out. For the rest of your stay we will respect your privacy as we ourselves also value the quiet way of life.
description.house_rules: No unauthorized, overnight guests allowed. Additional, well-announced and documented guests may stay overnight, only via an adaptation of the official reservation, and will be charged 30€ per person per night

hosts.about:
Hi, Im Willy from Puerto Rico. I'm a hospitality industry veteran and musician. Most of my traveling I do when touring with my band, and that's mostly work and no play, but when I do vacation I like to relax and take in the local sights, cultures, foods and adventures my surroundings have to offer. I am fluent in spanish and english.

I am also an airbnb host of several properties and now a days you can find me working with Crash Boat Experiences, a local tour company that provides Boat Tours, Hiking Excursions, Surfing Lessons and more in the beautiful town of Aguadilla, Puerto Rico. If you’re in town, please reach out and lets have some fun together :)

recent.comments: This was a true piece of heaven! My front yard was the beach. I never want to leave ❤️

items.comments: This was a true piece of heaven! My front yard was the beach. I never want to leave ❤️
Beautiful place right in front of the water .

This place was absolutely stunning. I was in paradise. Loved taking naps on the hammock. Will definitely recommend this spot for a private getaway for solo trippers,  like myself, or for couples. Thank you for the hospitality. This was a stay to remember 💖

This place surpassed our expectations. I have nothing bad to say. Clean, comfy, cozy, had everything we needed, wonderful A/C, beautiful outdoor shower. I loved it had hanging tools everywhere. Will come again!!!!

If you’re looking for a peaceful & private stay right on the beach then book The Nest! Waking up to the view of crystal clear water is a once in a lifetime experience. I was able to enjoy almost all of the Host’s food & activity recommendations, they are very attentive which made me feel at home even more!

We loved our stay at the nest. Crash boat Beach is a very special place and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The beautiful views and outdoor space were the highlight of this location. It is definitely more of a social/party scene on the weekends so if you’re looking for a quiet getaway, this is not it. There are lots of fun activities to do on the beach, including jumping off the pier which was an unexpected highlight for us. The host was super helpful and responsive. A beautiful stay. Definitely recommend.
Perfect location for couples getaway. Beautiful surroundigs. Just amazing.

description.summary: Enjoy romantic sunsets right on your front steps. The Nest is the only exclusive waterfront property on beautiful Crash Boat Beach. Relax on your very own beachfront deck complete with a shaded hammock area and a lounging sunbed area that complements our cozy air-conditioned studio apartment overlooking the ocean.  Our beautiful outdoor garden shower and exterior bathroom are an experience all on their own. Two guest parking spaces are located right on the property for your convenience.
description.space: Only some 15 to 20 paces take you from your queen bed right to the water. After a swim on the ocean, you can refresh yourself in your private garden shower and then jump in the hammock for a quick afternoon siesta while listening to the crashing waves nearby.  Our studio apartment is air-conditioned has a small kitchenette area equipped with a refrigerator, microwave, and stocked coffee station. An indoor half-bathroom with a gorgeous beach view is another great way to start your day.
description.notes:
Iguanas, small crabs and other, non poison animals such as mosquitoes might be spotted on the premises. These animals are part of our ecosystem and harmless. 

Jellyfish, although not common,  are known to be found on the ocean, mostly during non-summer months.

Our beach is fairly protected from currents given its position on the bay. Nonetheless you will swim at your own risk. There are no lifeguards on beach.
description.neighborhood: Food vendors can be found on the public beach parking lot during the day,  but trendy Cocoloba is the only restaurant at the beach and offers live music on weekends and brunch on special occasions. Reservations are highly suggested. Other great restaurants, bakeries, supermarkets, pharmacies & places of interest are just a short drive away.
description.transit: Outside the San Juan metro area, uber has not yet flourished so renting a car is highly recommended as taxis can get expensive. Public transportation is very unreliable and hard to come by.
description.interaction: You’ll have the place to yourself. Our co-host/property manager lives a short drive away and can help guide you with the reservation process or inquiries and can also help facilitate special service requests like surf lessons, yoga sessions, boat or hiking tours, paddleboard & kayak rentals, and other services.
description.house_rules:
Camping tents are not allowed on the property without owner's consent and may require additional charges.
PERSONAL PROPERTY: Tenant’s or guest’s personal property and vehicles are not insured by landlord, property owner, property manager, or community association, against loss or damage due to theft, fire, vandalism, rain, water or negligent acts of others or any other cause.  We are not responsible for any lost, vandalism or theft, to personal property or vehicles, accidents or casualties on our property. We suggest adding vacation insurance with your local travel agency.
CLEANING: There is an additional cleaning fee of $125 that will cover changing and washing sheets, towels, clean bathrooms, bedrooms, kitchen, decks and floors, etc. at your departure.  Any additional or excessive cleaning needed or items missing or damaged will be charged to you.  We reserve the right to keep all security deposits to cover such costs. **Stays longer than 1 week will have a complimentary change of sheets and towels every 5 day**
Help maintain the beach clean, do not litter.
Although we understand you might have some friends and family over to say hello and catch up, large parties are not permitted on the property. Violation of any of the house rules or Airbnb rules may result in immediate cancelation of the reservation and eviction without refunds.
Guests will be responsible for leaving the space clean and organized as close to as you found it. Additional charges may apply for any damaged property caused by guests or their pets or un authorized guests during your stay.
Two keys are provided to each guest. We reserve the right to request a $150 charge for damaged or lost keys (per key). We recommend returning keys to lockbox when leaving property unattended.
There is an outdoor trash can provided for your convenience. Upon check out, all trash and un-consumed food products shall be disposed of on trash container located by the public beach parking lot.
Grill should be kept as clean as possible to prevent unwanted animals and pests on the area.
Illegal weapons and controlled substances are not allowed on the property and may constitute in direct violations of house rules and Airbnb policies.
Smoking is not allowed on the interior of the property. If you need to, please do so outside and properly dispose of cigarette butts properly. Please do not throw in yard, beach or water as it directly harms the environment.  We are a medical cannabis friendly property.
 Our apartment provides enough sleeping accommodations for two (2) persons. Tenant/Guest shall not sublet or rent the property to others. We understand you may wish to invite guests such as friends or family for catching up or small get-togethers and are welcomed to do so only as a day visit and strictly following all the guidelines agreed upon on the airbnb contract. 
Tenants/guests agree that they will not claim the apartment owners for any damages, fire, accidents, injuries, casualties, vandalism or thefts, to any persons or property during your stay, at the apartment “The Nest”, the beach or surroundings. 
The property is rented to adults only, any minor children coming in as guests of the renters must be supervised at all times. Minors are not allowed to drink alcohol on our property. 
The ocean is a public beach area and not part of our private property. No lifeguard is on duty. Swim at own risk. Please do not swim or drive under the influence of alcohol.
The use of illegal drugs on our property is prohibited and will result in immediate eviction from our property and total loss of your security deposit and rental payment.
WEATHER:  Rain, wind, storms, hurricanes, weather, etc. are not predictable.  Therefore we will not be responsible or give out refunds for any adverse weather conditions once you have occupied our property or occur during your stay.  Cancellations due to hurricanes will be subject to rescheduling to an alternate date and subject to availability.
MAINTENANCE: You are renting a cleaned and furnished apartment with a certain inventory of items, such as appliances, Internet modem, a/c remote controls, towels, kitchen utensils, plates, glassware, etc.  We expect all occupants to properly use, operate, safeguard and take care of Premises, including furniture, appliances, furnishings, and all electrical, plumbing fixtures, and keep them and the premises clean and sanitary.
NOISE RULE: Please be respectful to other guests and neighbors and keep noise down, especially before 8 a.m. and after 10 p.m.   We may cancel your reservation at any time if we get complaints from neighbors or any resident about anyone in your group not complying with the rules.  Not following this rule may represent your immediate eviction from our property and total loss of your security deposit and rental payment.
PETS:  One Small/Medium size pet is allowed in the apartment and must be informed and approved prior to your reservation. Pet fee will be added. Guests will need to take care of the cleaning after your pet and droppings shall be disposed of properly on “doggie bags” provided by the pet owner and  placed in the outside trash can. Not following this rule may represent your immediate eviction from our property and total loss of your security deposit and rental payment.  Damage to furniture, mattresses or any other property damage caused by pet will also constitute loss of deposit.
PARKING:  Parking is provided and permitted on property entrance (maximum of two cars, side by side). Visitors shall park in public parking lots outside of the property and shall not impede traffic to and from the property, beach path or block neighbors assigned parking spaces.
CHECK-IN/OUT:  Your “check–in” time will start at 4:00 pm. “Check-out” time will be no later than 11:00 am. “The Nest” is a self check in property and directions and lockbox code will be provided on the day of arrival. Other arrangements may be made upon request (but not guaranteed), all requests will depend on availability.  At departure please make sure all dishes are clean, take out the garbage and return the keys to the lockbox.

name: Exquisite Estate | Private Cove | Serene Retreat
title: Santa Cruz la Laguna, Guatemala

location.address: Santa Cruz la Laguna, Sololá Department, Guatemala

gallery.caption: Granite Patio Overlooking Private Swimming Cove
Waterfront Terraced Gardens Surrounded by Cliffs
Dining Table (expands to seat up to 14)
Master Bedroom Patio with Outdoor Bath and Sun Chairs
View from Master BR Patio (and fruit trees!)
Master Bedroom 2 (w/ king or two twins)
Tropical Wood and Exposed Palapa Ceilings
The Sleeping Loft: Queen and Double beds ("Bedroom 4")
Entry Room/Den with Grotto and Full Bath
The Den with single Daybed and Queen Air Mattress plus en-suite bath ("Bedroom 5")
Pizza Oven and Temescal Sauna (on left)
Pizza Oven and Grill Built Into Rock "Cave"
Steps from Sauna into Lake to Cool Off
Stairs Leading to Mountain Footpath that Circles Lake
View from Mountain Path Above House
Public Boats Pass Every 15 minutes Each Direction
View from Upper Mountain Path (Property Circled) Great Hiking Around!

hosts.about: I'm a former lawyer, a wife, and a mother.  Love to travel!  Non-smoker. Nice :)

recent.comments: The estate and the views were breathtaking. My only concern were the amount of spiders and animals. The description mentions spiders so we expected a few but you can expect to see a large and potentially poisonous spider every hour. Then they have a cat on the grounds that snuck into the home and someone in our group is allergic. We had a lizard sneak in. And a stray dog came from out of no where and wouldn’t let us make our pizzas in peace or eat outside. During the day most of this is fine and makes for a good memory but I wish the beds had a net around them so you can sleep in peace and not be so concerned about the animals and spiders. But overall we loved our stay. The host were extremely accommodating and helped us book everything we needed.

items.comments: The estate and the views were breathtaking. My only concern were the amount of spiders and animals. The description mentions spiders so we expected a few but you can expect to see a large and potentially poisonous spider every hour. Then they have a cat on the grounds that snuck into the home and someone in our group is allergic. We had a lizard sneak in. And a stray dog came from out of no where and wouldn’t let us make our pizzas in peace or eat outside. During the day most of this is fine and makes for a good memory but I wish the beds had a net around them so you can sleep in peace and not be so concerned about the animals and spiders. But overall we loved our stay. The host were extremely accommodating and helped us book everything we needed.

Best Airbnb experience yet. The property was absolutely beautiful! Looked even better than the pictures. Such a peaceful and private location. We enjoyed using the paddle boards and kayaks while we were there and especially loved the services such as massages and personal chefs. The food was AMAZING and the ladies who prepared our meals for us were very sweet. I would definitely love to go back some time and stay longer. 100% recommend this property to any family looking for a place to stay near Panajachel.

Eleven family members including two under three years old stayed here comfortably and happily! It is truly a blissful place. We used the sauna (wonderful) and the brick oven pizzas (fun and yummy!) The groundskeeper Pasquale, started our days with a warm smile and Ventura was ready to help with anything we needed.  We had cooks come to the house and they were great, too. We recommend this place most highly- and we recommend that you follow all the suggestions about what to do that they provide you. There is a reason they are super hosts and they deserve to be. Fantastic vacation!!!

This breathtaking Airbnb with beautiful furnishings is brought to life by the extraordinary hospitality of staff and the welcoming presence of Mona, the beloved resident cat. Groundskeeper Ventura ensured impeccable maintenance, providing us a secure, organized, and clean space. The culinary team elevated our stay to a gourmet experience. Joel, our boat driver, offered patient, professional services, ensuring safe, enjoyable journeys- ferrying us from place to place with a smile on his face. Our stay was a perfect 10/10 experience, combining the comforts of a luxury home, the joy of connecting with adorable Mona, and the outstanding service from the amazing staff. We were sad to leave, but we are already planning our return. This Airbnb property has our highest recommendation. It's not just a vacation rental, it's a memorable experience that will make you yearn to come back, just like we do. And, of course, we can't wait to see our sweet Mona again!
We had a great time, everything was perfect!
Beautiful with amazing hosts
Amazing, beautiful, and peaceful home. Worth it. And will be coming back. Absolutely beautiful.

description.summary: Luxury, tranquility, stunning natural beauty.... Tropical plants and fruit trees surround this impressive villa overlooking a private swimming cove, where 70-foot cliffs plunge into clear water and frame spectacular volcano views.  Steam in the sauna, paddle the SUPs/kayaks, soak in the outdoor tub, or have a brick-oven pizza picnic.  Outdoor spaces abound for sunning, relaxing, al fresco dining and taking in the wonderful views.  Enjoy Lake Atitlan living at its very best.
description.space:
The uniquely designed Villa Patziac is the 6-acre retreat of an American Film and TV Director.  It has a bright and airy beach-vibe, with jaw-dropping views of the lake and volcanoes from every room and dramatic exposed rock-cliff walls throughout.  Access to the house is by BOAT ONLY.  

KITCHEN/DINING:  A large open-plan main floor boasts a fully-equipped  kitchen, dining table for 10-14, a double-sided fireplace, and a spacious living area with custom furniture that will comfort the whole family.  

SLEEPING:  A half-floor up, you will find a bedroom with a queen + bunk beds and a full bath with a view to the sky (Bedroom 3). Walk upstairs through a rock-wall atrium where you will find two large bedrooms (Bedrooms 1 and 2) each with king beds, patio access and its own bathroom--one with an outdoor soaking tub and shower.  There is also a charming sleeping Loft (Bedroom 4) with a queen + full-size bed reached by a stair-ladder that older kids, especially, will love.  The entry room/den, with full bath, doubles as an additional sleeping space with an extra-long twin daybed.  The house also has two air mattresses that can be used for extra guests.  All beds feature high-quality sheets and pillows with decadent down comforters.  
*Note: The 4th bedroom/Loft is not a standard bedroom, it is an open sleeping Loft (with railings), with a steep ladder to reach it. We recommend the loft for children over 8 and young adults. 

THE GROUNDS:  Outdoor features include--
Private Swimming Cove and Dock
Huge Waterfront Patio
Temezcal Sauna for 8
Wood-fired Pizza Oven (ask us about "pizza packs" to make your own pizzas)
3 Stand Up Paddle Boards
3 Kayaks (2 Single and 1 Double)
Palapa-covered Dining Area 
Infrared Saber Gas Grill
Charcoal Parilla/Grill
Terraced Lawns for lounging, playing, sunbathing or yoga (6 yoga mats provided in house)
Fruit Trees including avocado, papaya, guava, fig, and citrus
Life jackets and beach towels

LOCATION:  The house is located between the Mayan villages of Jaibalito and Tzununa, and is accessible only by boat to the private dock or via the footpath that circles the lake (you can walk to the neighboring villages).  We will arrange your private transport to the lake from the Airport, Guatemala City or Antigua and a private boat for your arrival and departure (fees are additional).  If you drive yourself, secure parking is available in Panajachel at Kayucos Marina, from where you will take a boat to the house. 

ADDITIONAL SERVICES:  During your stay the villa will be tidied daily by a housekeeper.  Additional cleaning or cooking services can be arranged upon request. 

Spa Services - The villa has two professional massage tables and we will arrange your private massage (Therapeutic, Shiatsu, Ayurvedic, Relaxing/Swedish, Deep Tissue). You may also have other spa services such as facials, manicure/pedicure and body scrubs.  Private Yoga and Reiki sessions, or an Astrology or Tarot card reading at the house are also possible.  SAUNA, SOAKING TUB, MASSAGE...create your own relaxing spa day without leaving the house!

Private Chef - We offer the services of wonderful cooks who will prepare breakfast, lunch and dinner for you (additional charge). 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**A note about pricing:  The base price includes 5 guests. We charge $30/night per each additional guest. The base price fluctuates according to season and demand. Look out for last-minute discounts!

*Please inquire about holding special events such as weddings and retreats (additional fees apply).

In addition to this house, we also have three great properties in Antigua.  Please see our host profile!

We look forward to hosting you.
description.access: You have access to the entire property.
description.notes:
This is a waterfront property that has some steep drop-offs. Small children should not wander the property unattended. 

A cat, Mona, lives on the grounds.  She is not permitted in the house so please do not let her in. 

INSECTS: The lake is in a rural, tropical area, which means there are bugs and insects. This area has a ubiquitous flat spider which will be found in every house despite the best efforts of any cleaning team. It is absolutely harmless. Rural Guatemala is also home to a non-lethal scorpion. Occasionally, you may find one or more in the house. We recommend using shoes when walking around at night/in the dark.

The house has filtered drinking water that comes from our natural spring above the property.  Kindly bring a reusable water bottle to fill up and take out with you. We discourage the purchase of single-use water and soda bottles in the lake area as many end up in the lake.
description.neighborhood:
**The Villa is not accessible by car. You will access it primarily by boat or on foot from the neighboring villages**

The Villa is located on the mountainside along the footpath between the quaint Mayan villages of Jaibalito and Tzununa (25 and 40 min walks or 5-minute public boat rides from the house). Santa Cruz is the next town over from Jaibalito. Visitors who discover this part of the lake at the end of their trip often lament not discovering it sooner. Here you will be immersed in nature, walking-distance from traditional Mayan villages not yet overrun with tourists, yet just a short boat ride away from bigger towns for more "action."  This is the perfect lake experience for those who want to get off the beaten path and away from the tourist traps of Panajachel, San Marcos and San Pedro and indulge in tranquil highland Guatemalan life.

Jaibalito and Tzununa remain very indigenous towns, where the local language, Kaqchikel, is spoken before Spanish. Tzununa is home to a number of eco-minded expats, including a permaculture farm (Atitlan Organics) that gives tours. There is a small, eclectic expat community in the town of Jaibalito, which is centered around the Posada Jaibalito--a must-visit spot for cheap, good food and interesting conversation (plus daily home-made bread and coffee roasted on-site).  Santa Cruz's charm lies in the paved walkways winding through lovely homes and a long walkable waterfront. Head up to the village to take in the incredible view and a meal or drink from CECAP, which is run by a US-based non-profit that does great work in the community.
description.transit:
Public boats ("lanchas") pass by the house's dock every 15 minutes going in two directions: east toward Panajachel (25 minutes) and west toward San Marcos (12 minutes) and San Pedro/San Juan (25 minutes). Private boats are also available, which we are happy to help you arrange.

If you are driving yourself to the lake, you will need to park your car in Panajachel (or San Pedro if coming from that direction). In Panajachel, there are two secure lots ("La Rampa" and Kayucos Marina) right next to the Tzan Juyu dock, from where you will take a boat to the house.
description.interaction:
Chris and Erynne, your hosts, although not available in person, will gladly answer all of your questions and give you advice on things to do, see and eat at the lake. You will be greeted upon arrival by the property caretaker who will be available throughout your stay to assist you. We do our best to ensure our guests have an outstanding experience of Lake Atitlan and Guatemala!

The caretaker, Ventura, and an assistant gardener live and work on the property.  Ventura's official work hours are 8:00 - 5:00 (with a lunch break around 1:00) but he will be glad to assist you later in the day with lighting the sauna or pizza oven if you ask him in advance.  His phone number is in the house guide.
description.house_rules:
Fees -- We Charge Additionally for more than 5 guests: $30/person per night. If you add more guests after booking, it is your responsibility to make that change to your reservation via Airbnb.

Special Events (Parties, retreats, weddings, etc.) allowed only with permission (additional fees apply).

Absolutely No Fireworks (Incendios/Bombas) are permitted on the property.

No Smoking inside the house please.

Visitors Allowed During the Day Only (up until 8pm). Visitors staying past 8pm will be considered overnight guests and additional charges may apply. Booked Guest is responsible for all other guests/visitors.

name: Romantische Höhle mit Terrasse und Meerblick
title: Gáldar, Spain

recent.comments:
Wir können uns den vorhergehenden, durchwegs positiven Bewertungen zu 100% anschliessen. Ein perfekter Ort um zu "entschleudern". Das Cueva Romántica war genau wie beschrieben, bis ins kleinste Detail liebevoll eingerichtet und doch  funktional. Wir haben nichts vermisst, auch den Fernseher nicht ;-). Das Klima in der Höhle ist erstaunlich angenehm. 
Ria ist eine äusserst aufmerksame und unkomplizierte Gastgeberin, sie gibt tolle Tipps und Ideen weiter und ist stehts verfügbar.

Leider war das Wetter zu Beginn unseres Aufenthalts nicht so gut und daher konnten wir die schöne Terrasse erst gegen Ende am Abend richtig auskosten. Die Aussicht auf Berge, das Meer und Teneriffa (bei Nacht oder klarer Sicht) ist wirklich sehenswert.

Die Anfahrt und das Parken ist etwas abenteuerlich. Ein grosses oder sportliches Fahrzeug ist nicht zu empfehlen, müsste einfach etwas weiter weg geparkt werden.

items.comments:
Wir können uns den vorhergehenden, durchwegs positiven Bewertungen zu 100% anschliessen. Ein perfekter Ort um zu "entschleudern". Das Cueva Romántica war genau wie beschrieben, bis ins kleinste Detail liebevoll eingerichtet und doch  funktional. Wir haben nichts vermisst, auch den Fernseher nicht ;-). Das Klima in der Höhle ist erstaunlich angenehm. 
Ria ist eine äusserst aufmerksame und unkomplizierte Gastgeberin, sie gibt tolle Tipps und Ideen weiter und ist stehts verfügbar.

Leider war das Wetter zu Beginn unseres Aufenthalts nicht so gut und daher konnten wir die schöne Terrasse erst gegen Ende am Abend richtig auskosten. Die Aussicht auf Berge, das Meer und Teneriffa (bei Nacht oder klarer Sicht) ist wirklich sehenswert.

Die Anfahrt und das Parken ist etwas abenteuerlich. Ein grosses oder sportliches Fahrzeug ist nicht zu empfehlen, müsste einfach etwas weiter weg geparkt werden.

Nous avons passé un très agréable séjour dans la ‘Cueva’, logement atypique, plein de charme. Bien équipé et avec une vue magnifique, ce fut notre point de chute pour une redécouverte de Gran Canaria. À recommander vivement à tous ceux qui veulent découvrir un autre côté de cette île que les resorts et plages bondées du sud.

Wer Ruhe weit ab von den Touristen-Hochburgen auf Gran Canaria sucht, ist bei Ria in der Cueva Romantica genau richtig.  In der super gemütlichen Höhle, die mit sehr viel Liebe eingerichtet wurde,  kann man das traditionelle Wohnen hautnah am Rand eines kleinen Bergdörfchens miterleben. Ria war immer direkt erreichbar,  wenn man Fragen hatte.  Sie hat uns auch mit vielen Tips für die Umgebung versorgt. Man ist schnell in den Bergen oder auch am Strand. Einkaufsmöglichkeiten gibts genug. Wir haben uns gleich wohlgefühlt. Auch die Hauskatze, die aber immer schön vor der Tür bleibt, vermittelt einem das Gefühl von Herzlichkeit, wie auch die vielen Accessoires in und um die Wohnung.  Entspannung pur in  der Natur und in der Umgebung viel zu Entdecken - so soll Urlaub sein ❣️

Loved staying here, Ria’s put a lot of love and care into everything, perfect for a couple and even though it feels remote and secluded it’s easy to drive to beaches and explore the area. Would definitely recommend.

Wir haben 6 Nächte in der Cueva Romantica verbracht. Die Gegend ist malerisch schön, tolle Wanderwege sind schnell zu erreichen und in der Gegend gibt es auch zwei Meerwasser-Schwimmbecken, die ein Baden auch bei hohem Wellengang erlauben. Die Wohnung hat einen phantastischen Ausblick auf Berge und Meer, ist bis in Detail liebevoll ausgestaltet und hat unsere Erwartungen übertroffen. Rita ist schnell zu erreichen, sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit.

Un super endroit ! Nous avons beaucoup apprécié le charme de la grotte mais aussi du petit village à flanc de colline. La localisation nous a parfaitement convenu car notre désir était surtout de découvrir de l’authenticité et de belles balades sauvages… une réussite !

Ria ist eine sehr aufmerksame Gastgeberin, die das Appartment liebevoll eingerichtet hat. Wir haben uns von Anfang an und bis zum Ende sehr wohl gefühlt. Alles nötige ist vorhanden und man hat genug Stauraum für die persönlichen Sachen. Ria hat uns einen Tag vor der Ankunft noch mit wertvollen Tipps versorgt und alles nochmals genau beschrieben und erklärt.
Die Unterkunft ist ruhig und etwas abseits vom ganzen Touristen-Rummel gelegen, was uns sehr zugesagt hat. Die beiden "Hauskatzen" Lulu und Sombre sind sehr süss und begrüssen einen jeden Morgen. Aber keine Angst, sie kommen nicht in die Unterkunft rein ;-)
Es gab bei unserer Ankunft (an einem Sonntag und somit ohne grosse Einkaufsmöglichkeiten) bereits das nötigste im Haus wie Olivenöl, Gewürze und Reis, sodass wir bereits ein erstes Abendessen kochen konnten.
Die Umgebung ist sehr schön, man sieht von der Terrasse aus das Meer und bei gutem Wetter auch bis nach Teneriffa rüber.
Wir kommen gerne wieder!!!

description.summary: Entspannt Euch in dieser besonderen und ruhigen Unterkunft und genießt romantische Zweisamkeit beim Sonnenuntergang und einem Glas Wein. Der spektakuläre Blick ins Tal (Barranco de Anzoe) aufs Meer bis zum Teide auf Teneriffa ist kaum zu übertreffen.  Die ca 45 m2 große Höhle mit Anbau ist über 100 Jahre alt und wurde im Sommer 2022 zu neuem Leben erweckt und liebevoll als Ferienwohnung renoviert. Die komfortable Ausstattung lässt FAST keine Wünsche offen (Achtung WLAN vorhanden, KEIN TV!! ;-)
description.transit: Mietwagen Ist erforderlich.

name: Perfect Location/Hot tub Cabin for summer vacation
title: Sevierville, Tennessee

gallery.caption: Great location cabin with mountain view. Close to everything. Or you can just stay inside and play games or watch shows.

Relax, enjoy, laugh! Spend time with or without your kids. :)

Watch TV or play games, your choice! Or just have some beer and chat with your loved ones.

King size bed Master bedroom w/ closet.
