description.summary: El Hayuelo es un conjunto de cabañas , apartaestudios y lofts, ubicados a 1 km del centro histórico.  La maloka 60 metros,  es una cabaña  de 2 niveles. Primer nivel cueva con cama doble, medio baño, lavadora . Segundo nivel cocina equipada con menaje, horno microondas, nevera, comedor, cama king, sala baño   privado con agua caliente,  zona para trabajo remoto, Linda vista a las montañas, jardines, terrazas, BBQ,  ideal para el descanso y trabajo online.
description.space:
Maloka:  dos niveles, Primer nivel habitación tipo cueva,  barbacoa,  terrazas, muebles exteriores,  construida entre piedras inamovibles desde hace 165 millones de años, cama doble y baño sin ducha, lavadora. Segundo nivel: cama King  convertible a dos camas sencillas. sala, mesa de trabajo, comedor-cocina  menaje nevera, balcón,  baño con ducha.

LA MALOKA se construyo sobre enormes piedras naturalmente colocadas en círculos desde hace 165  millones de años y rodeadas de especies propias del bosque montano bajo, visitada por colibríes. Su mas próximo vecino es un imponente árbol de Guamo.
Adobes, tejados tejidos en guadua, materiales naturales, espacio lleno de luz y confort.  Muchísima alegría y paz.

Espacios aptos para el teletrabajo, el arte, la creación el descanso.
Bellísima experiencia que  te da paz
description.access:
Caminar a la plaza principal 20 minutos, al observatorio astronómico muisca 40 minutos,  a restaurantes 10 minutos a supermercado 5 minutos . Pueden llamar taxi, alquilar bicicletas.  Todo lo que necesitan esta carca.
 "Tan cerca de todo y tan carca al cielo"
description.notes: El hayuelo donde esta ubicada la maloka el guamo esta rodeado de naturaleza y jardines nativos, visitado por colibríes y pájaros, con bellos atardeceres y mucho silencio.  Especial para relajarse, trabajar si lo desean excelente internet,  bella vista y muy intimo.
description.neighborhood:
Estamos ubicados a un 1Km de la plaza principal, en la vereda Monquirá en un ambiente de silencio y naturaleza, territorio de contemplación y observación de la antigua cultura muisca, muy cerca de  lugares imperdibles como pozos azules, el valle de Zaquencipá, museo paleontológico, el fósil y al frente la casa terracota. En medio de jardines nativos y sobre piedras inamovibles desde hace 165 millones de años cuando este territorio fue un mar interior se encuentra este lugar mágico inspirado en la arquitectura ancestral de quienes 
 fueron sus primeros habitantes, excelente vista a los cerros de Iguaque, santuario y origen de la humanidad según la cultura precolombina muiscas.
description.transit: En taxi desde el terminal de transporte,  caminando  1 Km de la plaza principal (10 minutos), en carro privado (5 minutos) o  bicicleta, .Estamos ubicados frente a casa terracota.
description.interaction: Personalizada.
description.house_rules:
Respeto por la naturaleza y por los otros huéspedes para lo cual solicitamos un comportamiento sin ruido ni escándalos.
no esta permitido el ingreso de personas que no estén registradas en el check in.

name: Guayarmina el orgullo de Arico Cave Experience
title: Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Spain

location.address: Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Canarias, Spain

gallery.caption:
Guayarmina la cueva que se hizo con mucho cariño pensando en todo, adaptada para personas con movilidad reducida y su medio de transporte.

Al adaptarse tenemos que decir que es una obra maestra para disfrutar en familia, amigos/as (4 pax máximo)
Dormitorio con su area de trabajo, desconectar del mundo hace que seamos mas eficientes en nuestros trabajos y aquí se puede lograr, trabajar en el paraíso.
Descansar oyendo el silencio es algo que se destaca en esta cueva tan mágica
Cocina con todo lo necesario para poder realizarse los desayunos de sus sueños,  como el almuerzo o cena, dispone de nevera con amplio espacio ...lista para disfrutar

Entrada desde la cocina hacía los  cuartos con 2 camas dobles. 
Destacar la estabilidad de la temperatura todo el año 18/19 grados
La taza del vater dispone de barra de agarre homologada para hacer del baño un lugar seguro y cómodo

El baño dispone de dos entradas una por este cuarto y la otra por el otro cuarto, al cerrar una puerta se esta en total intimidad, aun que esta cueva no se comparte hemos creado este sistema para dar privacidad al cliente.
Entrada hacia el área común donde se ubica Guayarmina

hosts.about:
Hola, soy un canario que junto con otro canario aunamos recursos y hemos creado la mejor experiencia de Tenerife.
 Promotor turístico, guía, monitor Sup, deporte adaptado y gestor de Arico Cave Experience

recent.comments: gracias

items.comments: gracias

description.summary:
Vuelve a conectar con la naturaleza con esta escapada inolvidable.
Guayarmina es una cueva adaptada, cuenta con 2 habitaciones, 2 camas de matrimonio, salón, cocina y un baño adaptado con accesos adaptados al lavamanos, plato ducha, WC. 
Guayarmina se encuentra en el área común junto con dos cuevas mas Maday a su izquierda y Bencomo a su derecha, totalmente independiente del resto ofrece una estancia perfecta para el descanso y la conexión  con la naturaleza. 
Un lugar unico en la tierra

name: True Cold War Relic Atlas F Missile Silo / Bunker
title: Roswell, New Mexico

recent.comments:
This was quite an experience! The price may seem a little steep, but you are paying for a whole immersive experience! Well worth it!

Raul, the hardworking, talented handyman and artist, greeted us and brought our bags down to start the tour. Before continuing, we got to talk with Gary for a while about the fascinating history of the Atlas missile program, and how he became the Siloman! Gary is a truly interesting and knowledgeable man, with a heart of gold! His wife Ava has quite a beautiful personality as well! The whole family emits infectious positivity, despite the dark history of the place they call home. 

While here, truly immerse yourself in the experience! Read some of the history from the books and magazines in his extensive collection, watch one of the atomic bomb history DVDs, go into the silo with just a flashlight and listen to the bats in silence, put yourself in the mindset of those who worked there. 

Such a cool place to see and experience!

items.comments:
This was quite an experience! The price may seem a little steep, but you are paying for a whole immersive experience! Well worth it!

Raul, the hardworking, talented handyman and artist, greeted us and brought our bags down to start the tour. Before continuing, we got to talk with Gary for a while about the fascinating history of the Atlas missile program, and how he became the Siloman! Gary is a truly interesting and knowledgeable man, with a heart of gold! His wife Ava has quite a beautiful personality as well! The whole family emits infectious positivity, despite the dark history of the place they call home. 

While here, truly immerse yourself in the experience! Read some of the history from the books and magazines in his extensive collection, watch one of the atomic bomb history DVDs, go into the silo with just a flashlight and listen to the bats in silence, put yourself in the mindset of those who worked there. 

Such a cool place to see and experience!

Amazing place, and the tour/history lesson was fantastic.  Both Gary and Raul were friendly and accommodating.  This is not a cheap rate, but it was worth every penny. Highly recommend this experience.

I can't believe this place exists. Gary turned a 1960 missile bunker into a squeaky-clean apartment. And, he appears to have every magazine, book and photo from the era. The underground museum/apartment has strong wifi, a full kitchen and comfortable bedding--once you turn the lights out, you'll get the best sleep of your life (no windows!).

I couldn’t recommend more! I was on the fence because it wasnt clear how many stairs to get to the apartment but it is just a flight.  The coolest place Ive ever stayed and Gary and Raul are first class guys!  They even had food and drinks stocked for us!!
Amazing, one of a kind location. Can’t recommend enough, stay there once in your life and experience the silence, serenity and cool temps of the silo!

What an incredible experience for us to partake in! Thank you Gary and Raul for allowing us to delve into such history first hand! Gary is so experienced and knowledgeable about the site and the history and Raul was so helpful and a great tour guide! Plus being able to spend the night in the silo was a chance of a lifetime! We highly recommend this experience! We will be back! Thanks for a memorable and history filled opportunity.
We really enjoyed our stay! Even though it was only a night, it was well worth it. If you are interested in history, or just want a unique experience, we definitely recommend it.

description.summary: The Missile Base / Bunker property with its former upper level underground Launch Control Center as your PRIVATE APARTMENT and a Utility Tunnel that leads to the Missile Silo nearly 186 feet deep, with much of its original floors still intact. Learn what it took to operate one of these amazing sites. The major construction/refurbishment areas, have been renovated into an unbelievable underground home and office. Prepare for one of the most awesome tours included with the cost of your stay.
description.space:
Experience an unparalleled stay at our unique Missile Base / Bunker property, complete with an underground Launch Control Center and Utility Tunnel leading to an 186 ft deep Missile Silo. Immerse yourself in the history of these remarkable sites and discover what it took to operate them. The major construction/refurbishment areas have been transformed into an incredible underground home and office, offering a one-of-a-kind experience. Your stay includes an amazing tour, providing insight into the fascinating history of the property.
Your private apartment is located on the former upper level of the launch control center, complete with numerous books and displays showcasing the early days of our Missile Heritage. Relax in the comfort of a complete living suite, while the owners reside on the lower level of the former launch control center. Stay connected with underground cellular service and Wi-Fi available for your convenience.
Don't miss the opportunity to stay at this incredible property and discover the unique history it has to offer.

Enjoy the former upper level of the launch control center as your private apartment with numerous books and displays showing the early days of our Missile Heritage as well as a complete living suite.  Owners live on the lower level of the former launch control center.
description.access: The entire upper level of the former Launch Control Center is your Private Apartment approximately 1250 sq ft.  Also includes a fully stocked kitchen with food and drinks.
description.notes: Underground cellular service and Wi-Fi is available.  Also includes a fully stocked kitchen with food and drinks.
description.neighborhood: You will be surrounded by the High Desert of Southeastern New Mexico with some of the most awesome Sun Sets.
description.transit: Only 18 miles from downtown Roswell and the World FAMOUS UFO Museum and numerous shops and restaurants.
description.interaction: While visiting you will be immersed in First Generation Missile Heritage by no other that one of the most distinguished speakers regarding these Missile Sites throughout America.

name: Smith Lake Cave with waterfalls & more
title: Houston, Alabama

gallery.caption: Dusk in the cave begins a shift to a breathtaking overnight shelter to explore.

Christmas time in the Cave is certainly special.   This couple was very welcome, we were happy to offer the opportunity.

We appreciate their kind words and hope you add to our guestbook down the road.

Another wedding anniversary, another happy couple... A place to connect and renew while you enjoy mother nature away from the hustle and bustle... 

We appreciate their kind words and hope you add to our guestbook down the road.

Coming down from the top of the bluff, turn past the waterfalls to get your first glimpse of the main cabin, with just the fireplace and front of the house enjoying the sunlight in the early part of the day.

Looking up from the waterfalls to the cabin, you can see the comforting glow of civilization in the cave.  The front section of the cabin including the massive chimney juts out from the cave just enough to let the smoke rise.
From the stone stairwell cut into the cliff, a glimpse at the mouth of the cave, lit by the sun setting across the lake.
Unique cave lighting gives you endless visuals everywhere you look.
The original shelter, with some manmade improvements.  Enjoy the great outdoors with fresh air, sunlight, shade, fire, water, and earth all around, and stone above you.
Timeless elements of stone, wood, metal, fire, and water abound, incorporated into the outdoor living space.

As the year draws to a close, the lake retreats from the cave, leaving a small private beach.  Fall and winter are not a great time for swimming in the lake, but a perfect time for blazing firepits and hot outdoor showers under the sky or the cave...
A Fall / Winter view of the lake as it retreats from the summer months.  Tucked in the back of the slough, the Cave offers a secluded location with just a handful of docks on the lake.
A view from the lake doesn't reveal the full depth of the cave, but the massive rock hints at it.
Dusk by the waterfalls.  Explore the creek fed by two waterfalls, or just find a seat to relax to the sound of the water, and light a fire on chilly nights.

The large natural cave water basin, endlessly refilled by water flowing through the rock itself.  A reminder of how the cave was formed, the water is cool all year.  Take a refreshing natural bath on a warm day, or a chilly quick one n cool days...

The sun rises behind the cave and sets across from its mouth, so mornings stay cool while the afternoon makes the cave a great place to bask in the sun until it hides behind the ridge across the lake.
Views from the cabin are expansive and in every direction, including the front door in this case.  Smoke from a firepit rising over the main outside deck wafts through the treeline.

The Cave can prompt a lot of superlatives... These folks came as a pair of couples, enjoying a few nights together on cold nights, staying cozy with fires in the Cave and in the house.  

We appreciate their kind words.
One of the two outside showers, the Tree Shower lets you reclaim your spirit under the open sky and trees around you, with hot water to combat even a chilly day.
The Lion's Den beckons... Within the Cave there lies yet another destination, with a fireplace, bar, and intimate seating in a stone walled den.

If Mother Nature overwhelms the natural shelter with cold and even the outside firepits are not enough for you, retreat to the cabin with its large stone fireplace and take a seat on the hearth to restore yourself.
Windows cover the front wall of the cabin, overlooking the lake.
The main bedroom has a door directly out to the cave, with views of the cave and the lake.

A sparkling review of the cave experience.  It's more than a night at a hotel or a house.  It's a place to make memories.

We appreciate their kind words and hope you add to our guestbook down the road.
The outdoors brought indoors, with a tree trunk sink.

A heartwarming welcome home gathering, that led into a surprise overnight for a happy couple.

We appreciate their kind words and hope you add to our guestbook down the road.
The waterfalls change with the weather and rainfall patterns...
But they are always beautiful and offering a splashing invite to explore them.
A mix of modern and rustic in the spacious shower (2nd showerhead to the right!)
Dusk with lighting of the cave...
There are many places to find a little piece of tranquility and nature to enjoy, during the day and at night.
Cooking can be the original Caveman Style over a firepit...
Or your meal can be a more elegant sitdown in the cave...

recent.comments: Great place… enjoyed the view and adventure. Completely worth the workout to get in and out of the home! Perfect place to land for a few days of r&r! Thanks again!

items.comments: Great place… enjoyed the view and adventure. Completely worth the workout to get in and out of the home! Perfect place to land for a few days of r&r! Thanks again!

The Cave House was a unique and fun place to stay. The reception is very spotty in the house but if you walk up the stairs you can get signal every time. We really liked sitting on the deck overlooking the lake and taking the kayaks out. The sweet neighborhood dog was a plus:) Jordan was a great host.
We had a great time with 2 teenagers. It was an experience we won’t forget. Wish we knew smith lake better, but it was fun learning from the locals!

Imagine Matthew McConoughey playing a caveman. This would be his cave.
You arrive on the road above the cave, marked by a wooden swing and small unassuming pergola that starts your journey down a stairway to an oasis. As you take your first few steps your sensoria are awakened to the sound of a waterfall.
This isn’t water sliding down rocks. It's a 20' waterfall! As you see the first sign of a cabin built in a cave, you cant help but look at its intended view. Beautiful Smith Lake, where this Cave-Cabin sits at the end of a small canal calling you to come play.
You end the stairway journey on a beautiful wood deck filled will various sitting arrangements to accommodate large parties with intimate sitting vignettes.  Or if you’re like me, an intimate magical place safely tucked off the grid from the entire world.  To any write, poet or philosopher – prepare to have your imagination rewired for your next creative unleashing!

ONCE IN A LIFETIME OPPORTUNITY, WELL WORTH IT!
This home made us speechless! The natural beauty surrounding this property, with 3 waterfalls, lakefront, all the amenities, was magical & worth every dollar spent. This property is perfect for families w/children, adults, & nature lovers. The home has everything you would need with an added bonus of an extremely comfortable bed. I brought my 10 year old son, he loved taking a shower in the waterfalls, kayaking the lake and swimming. It was so relaxing & peaceful for me, I was stress-free. Words cannot express how amazing this home is. 

PROS: Seeing wildlife such as Hummingbirds, Salamanders, baby frogs, dragonflies, and even the neighbors dogs came to visit! The property had washer/dryer, full kitchen, bonfire pits, swings, hammock, boats, lakefront views, cooler temps in the cave, perfect lighting, privacy, safety & internet. 

CONS: Finding garbage on the grounds, no grill brush, no tarp to keep firewood dry & bed is collapsing.
We had a wonderful time. The surroundings were beautiful and we were truly able to relax and enjoy our quick weekend getaway.
Beautiful surroundings and a unique getaway.  Thank you!

description.summary:
You won't find anything with more character than the Cave and its surroundings.  Nestled at the end of a slough on Smith Lake, its seclusion adds to the appeal.  Explore the waterfalls, the lake, and the cave and its unique features.   Retire to the rustic cabin with beautiful lake views, indoor fireplace, and natural accents. 
Note that there is a set of steps (~25) to get to the cave.
Ask us about options to accommodate more guests than the 4 listed.
Bookings offered only 3 months in advance
description.space: This is a rustic secluded location, set down away from the normal lake front properties which are up above on the ridge line.  When you descend to the cave, you find a quiet refuge with beautiful natural scenery along with all the amenities you'd like in a private home.  The space includes many locations to relax and enjoy different views and scenes.
description.access: The highlight areas include the clifftop view of the lake, the waterfalls with firepit and picnic table, the lakefront decks and slopes offering fishing and lake watching, the swim pier at the end of a walkway leading into the lake, the Lion's Den with natural rock ceilings and more, two outside showers, the Cabin, and then the massive Cave itself, a roughly 1500 sq foot space with unique furniture and ambiance including multiple firepits.
description.notes:
The cabin sleeps 4 comfortably (2 in a main bedroom, 2 in the living room). 
 Note that there is an additional fee per person after the first 2, so please select the correct guest count when booking.  There are lots of options for a larger group to sleep at the cave, out in the cave itself or by the waterfalls, etc (sleeping bags / airbeds / as you might bring).  Ask us about groups beyond 4.

Although Alabama seasons are mild, they do introduce changes through the year, and the lake is managed by Alabama Power, meaning its level can fluctuate day to day.
Specifically, this means that
-the lake is generally 'full' (swimmable, boatable from the Cave dock) starting in March, and starts to get shallow by the dock towards the end of August
-the waterfalls never stop, but they are rain dependent; spring rains are most reliable for making them beautiful, but any heavy rains can cause massive torrents throughout the year
description.neighborhood: This is a rural area on the lake.  There are neighbors but typically you won't see anybody except driving into the location.  Most homes on the lake are on top of the ridge, out of sight, with only boat docks visible from the property.
description.transit: There is a circular driveway with parking for 3-5 cars.  It's a gravel driveway that mother nature often disturbs, so vehicles with low clearance need to be careful.
description.house_rules:
Smoking is not permitted in the cabin, but is welcome outside the cabin and in the Lion's Den.  This is an outdoor natural environment, with slippery slopes and a dangerous cliff. 

Use the stairs, walk slowly, use appropriate footwear (heels and sandals recommended only inside the cave itself). 

Use firepits and fireplaces but do not leave fires unattended.  

Be respectful of neighbors after 10 pm, keeping music and noise volume reasonable.  

If you are approached by a neighbor or outsider, please be respectful and share only that you are guests visiting.  Nobody else should come on the property.  

Lewis Smith Lake is a 'dry' lake, meaning that you could face penalties if you have unopened or opened alcohol in or on the lake (i.e., if on a kayak, a boat, or even swimming).

In addition, anybody over 16 may need an Alabama freshwater fishing license, even to fish off the property.  You can find the regulations and purchase a license online at outdooralabama . com

There is a guestbook in the cabin, we'd love to have you leave a personal note for us.

name: Luxury Titan II Nuclear Missile Complex
title: Vilonia, Arkansas

recent.comments: G.T. is an exceptional host and very accommodating. The work he has done to turn a decommissioned missile silo into luxurious accommodations is nothing short of incredible.  I definitely recommend this experience. There really is nothing like it!

items.comments: G.T. is an exceptional host and very accommodating. The work he has done to turn a decommissioned missile silo into luxurious accommodations is nothing short of incredible.  I definitely recommend this experience. There really is nothing like it!

Our stay was so cool! Our 11 year old son picked it out. He thought it would be awesome to stay in an underground missile silo and it was! 
GT, the host, was so nice and friendly. He was there when we checked in and out. Made sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed. The tour/history at the checkin was really neat. The facility was clean and very modern. Plenty of couches and places to sit with a full stocked kitchen, 2 bathrooms, and a projector with all of the streaming services available. The lights in all of the rooms work off of a tablet so you can customize them however you want. They have fans included beside every bed which we appreciated just for our comfort. We traveled to Conway for lunch/supper which is about 10 mins away. Lots of options for a variety of restaurants. Our son took his Xbox and hooked it up to the projector and played it on the big screen (wall). He loved that! 
Overall, a great experience. The host and staff were great the whole time.
The silo was a really unique and interesting place to stay. Very spacious and cool inside. It was epic to learn the history and know how close we were to it. The host was great. Definitely recommend.

This was a great once in a life experience!
GT restored the missle control center with so much love. We loved it to stay in such a historic environment. Unbelievable awesome!!
Thanks so much.

G.T. is an excellent host as well as an engaging historian. I rented the LCC for my brother's 40th birthday. All the guests that experienced it were in awe of the dedication required by G.T. and his team to convert the space into what it is today. It was a singular experience.

This was a bucket list stay at the missile silo! My husband and I loved our stay and will definitely be back for another stay. We really enjoyed the tour of the place and learning about the history of how it was decommissioned and turned into an Airbnb. This was one of his favorite places that we’ve ever stayed at for vacation!

Amazing experience!  Very impressed with the walk through and instructions.  We had everything we could have ever needed, and then some!  The stay in the command center was incredible. I can't wait to see the full-size mock-up of the Titan II complete.  Excellent job, GT!

description.summary:
Stay in a former Titan II Nuclear Missile Complex! You'll have the entire Launch Control Center (LCC) of about 3500 sq ft to yourself.

For any parties or commercial activity (photos sessions, music videos etc.) please reach out to us. Thanks!
description.space:
This is the original underground Launch Control Center of a decommissioned Titan II Nuclear Missile complex. It has been converted into a completely stand-alone home with a luxury master bed / bath, kitchen, theater / living space and multi-use space.

Being underground the place is typically cooler than a normal living space but extra blankets are provided.
description.access: Guests can access the original Launch Control Center and Blast Lock area. This is over 3000 sq ft and features a completely underground self-contained home.
description.notes: This is one of the most unique places available to stay in the world! Please ask any questions you may have. We'll talk after you book to make sure this will be a great place for you. Thanks!
description.neighborhood: The original missile base is 9 acres in the middle of about 200 acres of ranch land. So there's a lot of free space and quiet!
description.transit: Parking is easy! You'll park right next to the access portal that takes you down 35 feet to the front door. Don't worry, we'll be there to help you!
description.interaction:
The stay begins with a top to bottom tour and orientation of the entire space that usually takes an hour or so. We also help with luggage since it needs to go down 35 feet to the front door. :-)

For guests that stay more than one night, at a time that is good for you, we'll need to come in daily to empty the holding tank. This typically takes about 10 - 15 minutes.

Before booking we'll communicate through here but after you book we'll talk on the phone first just to make sure we have everything just like you like it! This is a very unique space and I want to make sure it will be great for your needs.
description.house_rules:
Before the stay we'll go through a tour and orientation. 

This listing is for overnight stays only. If you'd like to have others at the site or have an event (birthday, graduation, bachelor / bachelorette) that's something we can likely work out as an event. Contact us! - Titan Ranch Team

name: CASA DEL ARBOL BEST RATED HOUSE
title: Boca de Tomatlán, Mexico

hosts.about: Limpio ordenado y educado.

recent.comments:
Lugar maravilloso, lleno de experiencia, vale la pena visitar!
Nos recibieron muy amigablemente

items.comments:
Lugar maravilloso, lleno de experiencia, vale la pena visitar!
Nos recibieron muy amigablemente

Nuestros días en la casa del Árbol serán inolvidables estar en medio de la naturaleza y su habitad con todos los colores y sonidos fue espectacular. La casa tiene todo lo necesario para pasar unos días tranquilos fuera del bullicio de la ciudad es una casa tipo cabaña tiene  aire acondicionado, TV con películas ,agua caliente ,la piscina super refrescante y limpia cerca del muelle de Boca de Tomatlan que ahí están los taxis en lancha para llevarlos a las playas más hermosas de Puerto Vallarta como Colomitos,Madagascar,Caballo y las Animas . La vista desde casa a las montañas es hermosa incomparable . Queremos agradecer a Juan que nos ayudó en todo momento desde que llegamos hasta el día que nos fuimos super atento también Arturo nos hicieron sentir muy bien con todas sus atenciones.
Juan was very kind and responsive.  The home was located in a private area and near a   beautiful fishing village.

Juan was the best airbnb host I have ever had. He was very accommodating and helpful in getting us what we needed. He made checking in and out easy. Fair warning, if you are prone to mosquito bites make sure you get some deets before hand. I got bitten up pretty badly. Otherwise it was a wonderful stay!

un lugar muy tranquilo para relajarse y estar en contacto con la naturaleza, nos tocaron una lluvias muy fuertes, lo que si es que lleven un buen repelente por qué hay mosquitos, la alberca le daba un plus al alojamiento al ser privada, así como los juegos de mesa y libros para leer, hay una tienda en el pueblo cercano, lo que si se preparen para subir escalones por qué está en un lugar muy alto.

We had a lovely stay. Juan is an awesome host, Arturo (the cleaner) is extremely kind, and the people in Boca are helpful. The decks, pool, wildlife, and view were great. Of note - Boca is a small town and we usually taxied to other places for food. There is one small grocery store.

Amazing trip. Juan is a great host. He proactively ensured we had everything we needed. He connected us to the right people for an easy and memorable trip. Definitely a great spot to stay if you’re visiting. The people, the food, and the nature that envelops the house is astounding.

description.summary:
The house is located in Boca de Tomatlán  (10miles south of Puerto Vallarta) a nice little traditional fishing village settled by a river mouth. 

The house overlooks the ocean with spectacular views of the river mouth and surrounding mountains. Recently renovated, it is a true Mexican Casa nestled against the rock-walled hillside above the tree tops.
Property size 21527 squared food
description.space:
Immerse yourself in the comfort of this fantastic lush atmosphere while enjoying the outdoor terraces pool, full kitchen,  master bedroom with full bathroom, open living area with couches, extra bed, second full bathroom and gated off street parking. This is the best place to disconnect from ordinary life and reconnect with nature. The village down the road offers a true mexican experience, including traditional food stands and corner stores leading to the river.
"NOTE"
In order to maintain or low price, we don't include the cost of A/C, if you want it
 it has extra cost 15usd/night.
Airport transportation 38 USD or 700 pesos.  In case you want to stop in the market to get some food we can do that, just get some tip to Juan.
description.access: Guest have access to the whole property.
description.notes:
This is the last house up the hill with no neighbors on the side. If you want to get away from the stress THIS is right place.

If you want something from the store, Arturo can get them for you for a small tip (we recommend 5usd every time he goes). 

Before you go to sleep or leaving the house close all windows and doors and keep food at ALL TIMES inside the fridge to keep raccoons away.—

House cleaning  scheduled Monday to Saturday   1 pm to 3:30pm and includes:
-Bathroom cleaning
-Sweep and mop  
-pool cleaning

    —No glasses on the pool area—
The edge of the pool is very slippery
Remember save water and power 
our planet is beautiful. 

If you want wood for the fire at Night time 
Just pay for the wood $8usd/ load (10 pieces ) 
You can do it yourself everything is going to be set up. 
 

"NOTE"
In order to maintain or low price, we don't include the cost of A/C, if you want it
 it has extra cost 15usd/night

If you want to go fishing
Cost about $60usd/hour   (4 hours minimum)

Water, ice, fishing gear, Capitan and fishing license.

If you want a custom Tour we can organize it especially for you. We have a special USV truck with A/C 

I highly recommend to  visit all the South Shor outside the 
bay. 
Enjoy your stay!
description.neighborhood: Boca de Tomatlan is the most popular landing and departure bay for water taxis to the pristine  beaches in the south part of Banderas Bay, including Las Ánimas, Quimixto, Majahuitas and Yelapa. All the neighbors are very nice, most of the people are fishermen or operate transport for tourists.
description.transit: Easy access to the public transportation.
description.interaction:
Will be very happy to help you.
We also provide transportation we charge the same as a taxi.

Welcome to the master bedroom with double bed.
Cozy table and cushions for relaxing.
Possible layout change to acommodate two single beds.
Small corner lookout spot in main bedroom.
One of two single beds available.
Detail of rustic yet fully equipped kitchen.
View of palms from hiking trail.
Bask in the afternoon sun beside the cave.
Just a glimpse of the breathtaking panoramic view from cave.
Enjoy your stay at Acusa Seca Cave House!

hosts.about: Born and raised in Gran Canaria Island. Enjoying the alternative canarian lifestyle. Dad, nature lover, traveller, big passion for ocean, mountains and visual culture.

recent.comments: incroyable !!!!

items.comments: incroyable !!!!
Un immense merci à Manuel pour ce séjour hors du commun et hors du temps avec un panorama d'exception au calme. Ce fut une superbe expérience.
One of the most amazing places I have ever stayed in my life.

Un moment magique, hors du temps pour qui aime s’adonner à la contemplation des beautés de ce monde. Les mots me manquent… J’ai juste hâte de revenir ! Merci Manuel pour ta disponibilité et ton accueil attentionné et chaleureux

The pictures do not do this place justice. It is one of the most beautiful views I’ve ever seen. The cave house itself is adorable and the perfect temperature. We did not want to leave. There were three very sweet feral cats hanging around, who seemed to know they aren’t allowed in the main house. My only complaint would be the outside light that wouldn’t stop coming on and off randomly

We stayed for a week. The location is remote but beautiful. We had a lovely time hiking and exploring the local sights. There are some lovely small towns nearby and we drove to the coast on a couple of occasions. The accommodation is basic but that is what you expect, you are staying in a cave house. In my mind it is great value for the money.   
I would 100% recommend this to my friends but I would stress it is best suited for adventurous people. 
Manuel was very helpful.

Superbe lieu isolé mais calme et paisible avec une très belle vue depuis la terrasse. La route est bonne pour y accéder puis il faut marcher 5 minutes. Les équipements sont simples mais très bien conçus, super pratiques, on peut manger dans la cuisine comme dehors et le logement est souvent à l’ombre, ce qui est génial quand il fait chaud. Mention spéciale pour les palettes qui servent de transat, super agreable pour lire (il y a d’ailleurs des livres de dépannage dont un en français). Ne pas être allergique aux chats, quelques uns viennent tenir compagnie 😉

description.summary: Stunning accommodation in an even more amazing setting: experience the unique spirit of a cave dwelling with roots reaching back into the 6th century.
description.space: The main cave, excavated into the mountain following the tradition of Gran Canaria’s native inhabitants, can comfortably accommodate up to 4 people. It is equipped with a small table, cushions to sit on and a handcrafted wooden deck fitted into the rock. Combined with complete darkness at night and isothermic construction which keeps the cave at the perfect temperature, the cave offers one of the best sleeps of your life.
description.access:
Despite being far from civilization, Acusa Seca Cave House offers modern commodities including a hot shower, electricity and a fully equipped kitchen.
Apart from dorm, kitchen and bathroom the cave house also offers a large outdoor terrace with exceptional mountain views. The terrace is shielded from the elements by a natural overhang.
Reconnect with nature: whether you aim to reach the summit of a mountain or simply to sit back and recharge; take a step back from city life and spend some quality time in the great outdoors.
description.notes:
Only for adventure seekers: Leave your modern urban lifestyle at home, and in return, be rewarded with total peace, amazing mountain landscapes to explore and a night sky full of stars.
Reconnect with nature: Whether you aim to reach the summit of a mountain or simply to sit back and recharge; take a step back from city life and spend some quality time in the great outdoors.
Bring your own supplies or buy them at any Artenara Village shop. ( 15 min. drive from Acusa Seca ).
description.neighborhood: Acusa Seca settlement is located within one of the most unspoilt areas of Gran Canaria, just a stone´s throw from the nature reserve of Tamadaba. This part of the island is classified as a UNESCO Biosphere reserve and serves as a playground for outdoor enthusiasts. If you want to try some local products I can put in contact with local farmers and recommend you a family run goat cheesery just around the corner  providing the most original breakfast.
description.transit:
By car: 
First drive to Artenara village, starting either from Las Palmas, Maspalomas area or the village of La Aldea. From these three locations, there are well paved roads with clear signs taking you to Artenara. 
From Artenara take GC 210 to Tamadaba and after 3 kilometers you will see the sign to Acusa. Turn left onto the road to Acusa and after 10 minutes driving you will see the sign to Acusa Seca. The winding road to Acusa Seca will take you down to a parking lot. Leave your car there and walk down to Acusa Seca Cave Settlement.
At the end of the paved road you will see Cueva Dolores to your right. Take the main path down until you reach cave number 34.

By bus
1.Take the bus from Las Palmas to Artenara. 
Global Bus 216 from San Telmo to Teror: From 8am to 9pm every full hour, also on Sundays (30 min journey)
Global Bus 220 from Teror to Artenara: Mo-FR: 11:00, 14:15, 19:00/ SA: 11:00, 16:15/ SU: 8:15, 16:15   (1 hour journey)
2.Confirm your arrival time in advance (+(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)) so we can wait for you at the bus stop and drive you to the cave (5 min.), sharing the cost of petrol. If you would like to get to the hostel independently, just see below.

Hiking
If you are a hiker, good news! There is a beautiful, well signaled 1,5 hours hiking trail from Artenara to Acusa Seca. Go to the main square of Artenara village and follow the wooden hiking trail signs. You can also ask at the convenient tourist information office just next to the main square.
description.interaction: You will enjoy this exceptional accommodation just by yourself. I will handover keys in Las Palmas City or Artenara, as it suits you better and will provide all info about the accommodation and best local insights. As I am a fan of the great outdoors, I am more than happy to share tips about various activities including hiking, climbing, trail running and cycling. I can also give you a brief introduction to archeologial, ethnographic and enviromental values of this area.
description.house_rules: You are enjoying a truly unique archeological and natural site: respect site, nature and neighbours. Don't leave any trash and keep noise down after 21:00.

title: Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Spain

location.address: Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Canarias, Spain

gallery.caption:
More seaviews is imposibe! 

¡Mas vistas al mar es imposible!

Wake up looking at the ocean

Despiértate mirando el mar

From your dining table you can overlook the cove and the sea

Desde la mesa comedor puedes sobre ver la cala y el mar

Just next to the bedroom you have a balcony facing the sea

Justo alado de los dormitorios tienes un balcón mirando el mar

recent.comments: Un très bon séjour, un accueil très chaleureux ! Je recommande vivement

items.comments: Un très bon séjour, un accueil très chaleureux ! Je recommande vivement
très bon séjour chez Christelle, un accueil au top et un appartement très propre, bien situé et avec une vue magnifique sur l'océan !!!

Avons passé un séjour de rêve au dessus de l'océan! Logement très agréable dans un lieu authentique, idéalement situé. Christelle nous accueille avec plein de petites attentions et de très bons conseils.

Christelle est une hôte super accueillante, et pleine d’attentions.
La maison au bord de l’eau est très agréable. On peu se baigner au pied de l’appartement. Des restaurants sont accessibles à pied. L’un est juste à côté, et le village des Rodazul est accessible à 10 min à pied. Attention, il faut aimer le bruit de la mer pour s’endormir.
Merci à Christelle pour tous les conseils et l’arrivée. Le séjour s’est très bien passé, l’appartement est super bien situé et au calme. Je recommande

De tous nos lieux de sejour pendant une semaine ,nous vous conseillons a 300% de vivre chez Christelle , si nous revenons aux Canaries ,sans hésitation nous poserons nos valises chez elle pour continuer a decouvrir cette belle ile
Bravo Christelle et merci
Super moment dans ce petit village. La vue est à couper le souffle.

description.summary: Are you looking for a place to spend your holiday where you feel that you are almost in the sea? This is your house then! This frontline house has big windows overlooking the ocean. Fall asleep with the calming sound of the waves and wake up with the ocean smiling at you. Located in the small fisherman’s village Bocacangrejo far away from mass tourism but close to the city of Santa Cruz. The location is perfect to explore the rest of the island and you have the beach on 500 metres.
description.space:
When you enter your house the first thing you see are impressive open views over the ocean. On a clear day you can see the island of Gran Canaria and if you are lucky, you can spot whales or dolphins in the sea. You have a spacious living room with a comfortable sofa and a 50” smart TV with a Chromecast. The high dining table offers you incredible views overlooking the coves of the village where people enjoy a swim and in the distance the volcano of Guïmar, the bay of Candelaria and the la Nea beach. Attached to the living room you have your kitchen with a big fridge/freezer cooking hub, microwave, Dolce Gusto coffeemaker and all the kitchenware you need. 

Going down the stairs in the living room you reach the sleeping area. On the right hand you have the master bedroom with a comfortable big bed of 160cm by 200cm a gorgeous view over the ocean and a really big wardrobe to store your belongings. The sliding window doors give access to the balcony that overlooks the ocean and the cove, with two chairs and a table to enjoy the sunrise, the views or just the sun. The second bedroom has a bunkbed and also has access to the balcony. Next to the stairs you find the bathroom where the shower actually is using the rocks of the mountain on which the house is build.
description.neighborhood: Just 10 minutes from Santa Cruz the charming fishing village of Bocacangrejo can be found located on a beautiful hillside. Due to its protected location and its micro-climate, you can enjoy a great climate throughout the whole year. Designed for those who seek exclusive tourism and being far from mass tourism. It is an ideal place for walking, diving, or canoeing. Furthermore, due to its excellent location, it is a perfect starting point to discover the island of Tenerife. Worth to mention is that Bocacangrejo is a very good destination for lovers of scuba diving with several diving schools at only 10 minutes and a whole a paradise to discover bellow the sea.
description.transit: Bocacangrejo is located in a central point of the island. If you come from the north airport, your destination is just 19 km away by motorway. The airport in the south of the island is about 35 minutes away by car or a little over an hour by bus.

gallery.caption: Spacious and bright living room connected to eating/working nook.
King Sized, luxury foam hybrid bed
Medium firm king foam mattress, very comfortable
View into the house from the porch
Looking out from the bedroom out into the woods
A large open floor plan, with the kitchen be connected to the living room.
Full kitchen, with everything you need
You can see the top unit which is another rental until, for a majority of the year.

hosts.about: I'm open-minded, easy-going. A little bit more about myself: I graduated from Warren Wilson College, a work college with an environmental sustainability focus. I have been living in the Asheville area for 12 years.  I'm a certified RYT-200hr yoga teacher, . My hobbies include traveling, surfing, yoga, playing music, running, and adventure sports.

recent.comments:
I didn’t recall seeing that there were other guests staying above us on the app. The insulation was not what needed to soundproof the ceiling AND there was a family with four children staying above us. The first night of our three night stay, the children ran up and down the hall for hours. We left for three hours hoping that would be enough for the children to quiet down, but even after knocking on the ceiling with a broom, they continued into late night. When we reported it to Kyle as listed in the house instructions, the wife came downstairs and left a nasty note. She then came back and berated us. It felt threatening. That day and night she again let her children run up and down the house. 

Kyle was lovely, but not sure how assertive he was. This woman was a major bully though. And to be fair, there was a container of earplugs by our bed, which indicates that the owner knows of the issue. We would have left , but for the inconvenience of relocating. It was a major discomfort.

items.comments:
I didn’t recall seeing that there were other guests staying above us on the app. The insulation was not what needed to soundproof the ceiling AND there was a family with four children staying above us. The first night of our three night stay, the children ran up and down the hall for hours. We left for three hours hoping that would be enough for the children to quiet down, but even after knocking on the ceiling with a broom, they continued into late night. When we reported it to Kyle as listed in the house instructions, the wife came downstairs and left a nasty note. She then came back and berated us. It felt threatening. That day and night she again let her children run up and down the house. 

Kyle was lovely, but not sure how assertive he was. This woman was a major bully though. And to be fair, there was a container of earplugs by our bed, which indicates that the owner knows of the issue. We would have left , but for the inconvenience of relocating. It was a major discomfort.
n/a

The airbnb is in a great location. Close to downtown Black Mountain and quiet. It is modern and clean and you have a beautiful outdoor space. Be aware that the driveway is steep. If it was icy, I would have been unable to get up and down. Overall, great location, beautiful place, and good price!
Cool place and very convenient to stay in.
Amazing spot on Black Mountain!! Couldn’t reccomend more!
Adorable little get away in the mountains! Neighborhood is calm and quiet, but very close to groceries and restaurants. Peaceful surroundings, the apartment was clean, and the bed was very comfy.
Very nice, would stay again!

description.summary: Tranquil mountain retreat minutes to downtown Black Mountain. This 1100sq ft. studio apartment has a private entrance and separate driveway: Highlights of the space are a fully equipped modern kitchen, huge shower, comfy king bed, natural light, and relaxing environment. We pride ourselves on a clean, comfy, and quant space for our guests to relax in. You will also find beautiful views of the woods and surrounding mountains. And well as a plethora of flowers and wild life in the summer!
description.space:
Minutes to downtown but tucked far enough into the woods where you feel like it’s only you is what people love most about our space. Only a minute away you will find, a YMCA and the Chesire area that has a phenomenal sushi restaurant, hair salon, local food market and deli, and other quant stores and restaurants. Our location is also only 25 minutes to Lake Lure, and 20 minutes to Asheville. Not to brag but this 1100ft modern suite is eons nicer than any hotel at this price plus you are still very conveniently located to everything. Be prepared for the ultimate stay! This space is particularly unique because it's a brand new renovation with a modern but cozy design, lots of natural light, spacious layout and furnishing. This downstairs apartment is nestled in the woods, from every window you have a view of the woods. Step outside onto the bedroom balcony and smell the fresh mountain air. 

The upstairs of the house is an additional rental, when my mother is not living there. So you can sometimes hear other people as you would in a hotel.

It has a full kitchen with fridge, oven, and includes cookware and everything you would need to enjoy the comforts of a home. 

Huge bathroom and large shower and large bedroom.

Queen sized bed.

TV has smart tv capabilities and direct tv.

Fold out sleeper sofa for extra guests.

The house has Wireless internet.

Self check-in and arrival.
description.access:
You have the entire 1100 sq ft. downstairs apartment with private entrance to yourself.  The apartment has its own driveway and entrance. Full privacy. 
Pull into the first driveway on the left, 
The driveway is steep, but paved and isn't a problem for most cars. It can be tricky with ice or snow which is only an concern with bad weather. We have made large and nice steppers up to the house in case of poor weather. So no matter the weather the house is accessible.  There is parking at the bottom of the driveway and stone steppers a short walk from parking. Please notify me if you have any issues. 

In the case of snow or ice guests can park at the bottom of the driveway and walk up stone steppers and 150ft walk.

Early check-ins $25
Late check outs $25
description.notes:
The driveway is particularly steep, most cars should be able to make it. It is paved but steep.  You can park at the bottom and walk if you have any trouble. There are stone steppers not to far down the road (15ft) from the mailbox that you can walk up. Please notify me if you are having issues with the driveway

We have a pet fee of $40 dollars.
description.neighborhood: Very quiet and secluded neighborhood
description.interaction: Sheila my mother lives up stairs part time when she is not there it’s an additional Airbnb rental

hosts.about: Ich habe mein halbes Leben in Berlin verbracht und dort in einer großen Kulturinstitution gearbeitet. Mit der Finca bin ich aufgewachsen - meine Familie hat die Finca vor ca 25 Jahren erworben und nach und nach bewohnbar gemacht. Jetzt freue ich mich, diesen wunderschönen Ort mit Euch zu teilen.

recent.comments: It was delightful to stay in  Katharina’s place. It’s tranquil paradise in a mountain with beautiful views, cosy cave room, lovely yoga place, pool, beautiful nature around. It’s a place where you can really slow down and enjoy delightful simplicity of Life. Katherina is a very friendly host. with gratitude, Lena

We hebben ontzettend genoten van deze prachtige plek. Het is de ideale plek om tot je zelf te komen. 
Weg van de drukte, omringd met levende natuur.
Slapen in de grot is een beleving, de temperatuur blijft aangenaam en stabiel. 

Katharina staat altijd klaar voor haar gasten maar geeft je ook de ruimte om je gang te gaan. Ze is erg vriendelijk, dankbaar en behulpzaam.

Bedankt voor de fijne tijd!

This was magical! 
A perfect place to relax and enjoy the beautiful landscape around. 
Katharina is a very warm person, and will make sure you have a perfect stay. 
I will definitely come back one day, and recommend this place for everyone who wants to detox aswell a little bit ;)

The most majestic place you’ll stay in for a holiday. Picture yourself catching the sunrise and making your way to an outdoor shower followed by a walk through a sanctuary to reach a yoga platform to play in and then spend the rest of your day by the poolside soaking in all the sun. Would go back there in a second! 🌞✨💞🥰🦋
Wir hatten den schönsten Aufenthalt bei Katharina! Der Ort war einfach umwerfend und Katharina wahnsinnig warm und herzlich - rundum hatten wir die beste Auszeit, von Herzen dank nochmals <3

Katharina war eine tolle Gastgeberin, sie war immer für uns da und konnte uns bei jedem Anliegen helfen. Wir haben außerdem super Tipps für Ausflüge und Infos über Teneriffa bekommen. Man fühlt sich dort sehr zuhause. Die Anfahrt zur Finca ist mit der Wegbeschreibung gut zu finden, aber etwas abenteuerlich. Dafür genießt man oben die Ruhe und einen tollen Ausblick. Jede Höhle hat eine eigene Toilette mit Waschbecken sowie eine Dusche, die sehr sauber waren. Es gibt auch warmes Wasser, also stört es auch im Winter nicht, das beides außen ist. 
Es gehört auch eine Küche zu der Höhle, die mit allem ausgestattet ist, was man braucht. Es gibt zwar keinen Backofen, aber mit dem Gasherd kommt man auch super zurecht. 
Wir würden auf jeden Fall wieder kommen und hatten eine tolle Zeit.
Really interesting experience of living in a cave. The owner Katharina is an absolutely lovely lady who lives just next to these guest accommodations and is always here to help with everything.

description.summary: Unsere Finca liegt im Südosten von Teneriffa in den Bergen. Man genießt eine wunderbare Ruhe, herrliche Sonnenaufgänge und nachts einen sternklaren Himmel. Die Gegend ist dünn besiedelt, selten sind Nachbarn da. Autobahn und Strand sind nur 7km entfernt. Bei der Gestaltung der Finca haben wir uns an den natürlichen Strukturen des Geländes orientiert und so entstanden außergewöhnliche Unterkünfte. Drei unserer Höhlen haben wir in gemütliche Wohnräume verwandelt...
description.space:
Diese Höhle - wir nennen sie „Palmera“ weil am Sitzplatz eine Palme steht - ist in einem warmen Orange gestrichen. Die Einrichtung ist einfach, aber mit viel Liebe gestaltet. Sie hat ein großes, bequemes Bett, Lampen, die schönes Licht geben, eine Kommode, zwei Stühle, einen Couchtisch, Kleiderbügel...  Wenn Ihr möchtet, stellen wir die Betten auseinander, so dass Ihr zwei Einzelbetten habt. Vor der Höhle befindet sich ein eigener Sitzplatz mit einem weiten Blick zum Meer. 
Das Erlebnis, in einer Tuffsteinhöhle zu schlafen, ist unbeschreiblich schön. Schon die Ureinwohner der Kanaren, die Guanchen, wussten das und wohnten in Höhlen. Es ist angenehm kühl im Sommer und warm in den kälteren Winternächten. Die Luft ist frisch, da die Steine „atmen“, außerdem gibt es in der Tür ein kleines Fenster. 
Nach Bedarf bekommt Ihr im Winter ein elektronisches Heizgerät oder ein Moskitonetz, wobei wir hier wegen der Trockenheit nur sehr wenige Mücken haben. Hier wohnt Ihr naturnah und doch komfortabel.
Während der Pandemie habt Ihr ein Bad und eine Küche zu Eurer eigenen Verfügung! (Das heißt wir vermieten im Moment nie alle drei Höhlen gleichzeitig). Das Bad liegt ca 15m von der Höhle entfernt, die Küche ca 20m einen Weg hinunter. Auf diesen Wegen könnt Ihr auf andere Gäste oder uns treffen. Ansonsten aber habt Ihr Bad und Küche zu Eurer eigenen Verfügung!
description.access: Unsere Finca ist vier Hektar groß, unsere Gäste dürfen sich auf dem weitläufigen Gelände frei bewegen und können dabei ihren persönlichen Lieblingsplatz entdecken!
description.notes: In der Höhle selbst funktioniert das WLAN nicht, aber ca. 40m von der Höhle entfernt gibt es einen Hotspot, den man jederzeit nutzen kann.
description.neighborhood: Hier findet Ihr Ruhe, Natur pur, sternklare Nächte und tolle Sonnenaufgänge. Die herrlich saubere Luft ist gemischt mit dem Duft einheimischer Pflanzen.... Wer ein Restaurant oder Café in der Nähe braucht, könnte hier falsch sein, aber wer Ruhe sucht und ein gutes Glas Wein unter dem Sternenhimmel genießen will, hat einen guten Ort gefunden. Hier könnt Ihr Euch  entspannen, endlich mal ausschlafen, vielleicht ein Buch schreiben oder einfach nur Energie für Euer nächstes Abenteuer sammeln. Wenn Ihr mögt, machen wir Yoga mit Euch!
description.transit: Um hierher zu kommen, braucht Ihr unbedingt ein Auto. Die Straße zur Finca ist asphaltiert, aber auf den letzten zwei km schmal, manchmal steil, mit tollen Blicken in die Schlucht (Barranco de Icor)... Für geübte Fahrer ist der Weg eine Freude, für weniger Geübte eine Herausforderung, die aber mit jedem Mal leichter wird. Dafür werdet Ihr hier oben mit Applaus empfangen und werdet sehen, dass sich der Weg gelohnt hat.
description.interaction: Wir wohnen selber auf der Finca und sind für unsere Gäste gut erreichbar. Wir geben Euch gerne Tipps für den Urlaub auf der Insel, schließlich kennen wir sie schon ganz gut ;). Wir sprechen español, deutsch, english.
description.house_rules:
*Bitte lasst keine Lebensmittel offen rumstehen!
*Bitte hinterlasst die Bäder und die Küche immer sauber.
*Bitte entsorgt das Toilettenpapier im Müll und nicht in der Toilette, das Rohr verstopft sonst!
*Rauchen nur außerhalb der Unterkunft!
*Kein offenes Feuer (auch keine Kippen)! Wir leben in einer sehr trockenen Gegend!
D*A*N*K*E
*Wir haften nicht für Unfälle auf der Finca - das Gelände ist naturbelassen und teilweise sind Wege steil!
*Kinder brauchen - wegen des Geländes - die ständige Aufmerksamkeit der Eltern.

The cave house is absolutely stunning. Beautifully finished and equipped. Literally, a stones throw from the beautiful beach.

The cave has everything you need, and is a perfect temperature, however hot it was outside.

Cris gave recommendations to local shops, facilities, activities and was on hand to give advice, if required.  Communication was excellent and attention to detail was 5*.

I had just spent two months in  cavehouse in the mountains, which wad beautiful,  however the sunset from here over Tenerife is exquisite.

I loved the decor and quirkiness of the cave, and the shower was amazing.

The cave is spotlessly clean, accessble, you can park outside for 30 mins to unload then move car to local car park, so your view is unimpeded.

Local restaurants are very good, and Sardina is beautiful.

Cris is a wonderful person and so professional and caring. Thank you, I'll be back

La casa cueva de Cristina es un lugar que uno no puede dejar de visitar. Está en una de la playas más bonitas de Gran Canaria. Es un placer levantarse y acostarse con el ruido del mar, pues la cueva casi está encima de  la playa.  La Playa de Sardina  y Cristina, nuestra anfitriona, han dejado en nosotros un bonito recuerdo.  Ella desde el primer momento de la reserva hizo todo lo posible para que nuestra estancia en su cueva fuera lo más placentera posible. Muchas gracias Cristina.
Un lugar mágico. Dormir en una auténtica cueva frente al mar  con su sonido meciéndote ha sido una experiencia sin igual. Absolutamente recomendable

hosts.about:
I'm originally from North Wales in the United Kingdom, and I first visited Madeira in my 20's. I immediately fell in love with the Island and it quickly became a dream of mine to move here permanently.

When I'm not busy at Casa das Pedras, I enjoy sampling the local cuisine in Madeira (and the Poncha!), as well as Paddle Boarding off the coast and riding my mountain bike around the Island.

recent.comments:
Bereits bei Betreten des sehr hübsch gefliesten Zugangs hat man einen atemberaubenden Blick. Die Räume sind sehr schön hoch und individuell mit Kunst gestaltet. Die Waschmaschine war hilfreich, um mit kleinem Gepäck anreisen zu können. Eine Geschirrspülmaschine ist nicht vorhanden, hat uns aber nicht gefehlt. Das eine Schlafzimmer geht zur Terrasse raus, sodass man bereits beim Aufwachen diesen grandiosen Blick genießen kann. Der Pool und die beiden Liegestühle und der Hängesessel  waren super. Das Badezimmer mit Dusche kann man vom zweiten Schlafzimmer, und vom Wohnzimmer betreten. Es ist nicht mehr neu, aber sauber.
Die zweite Toilette ist draußen an der Terrasse, was sehr praktisch war. Das höher gelegene dritte Bett ist ca 120/140 cm breit und befindet sich im Wohnbereich. Die Einrichtung ist etwas in die Jahre gekommen, aber sauber. Wir hatten leider ein paar Ameisen im Haus. Adam hat sofort reagiert und uns geholfen. Wir haben uns im Casa uns sehr wohl gefühlt! Vielen Dank Adam!

Wir waren sehr begeistert von diesem wunderschönem Haus mit liebevoller Einrichtung. Gigantischer Blick aufs Meer, toller Pool, eine Grillecke und eine Terrasse, die gut genutzt wurde. Alles ist von der Unterkunft gut erreichbar und Parkmöglichkeiten sind auch gegeben. Sehr zu empfehlen! Vielen Dank. :)

Beautiful apartman! The view is breathtaking. We easily found our way there, and the entry was also simple. Well-equipped, spacious rooms, and a comfortable bed. The small grill area is very authentic, and we loved the pool! A special bonus is the selective waste collection and composting option! Beckie and Jamie are extremely kind and attentive hosts. Throughout our stay, they made sure everything was fine. I can only recommend it! It's worth every penny!

Located in the country, yet just 20 minutes drive from Funchal and easy access to all parts of the island. 

Fabulous base camp to spend days exploring the island and evenings relaxing by the pool, enjoying with the sea view.

For morning walks, we are located close to Lavada do Norte.

description.summary:
Disfrute de unas inolvidables vacaciones en nuestra hermosa cueva, excavada en el corazón de la montaña, en el sur de Tenerife.
Los Guanches, primitivos habitantes de la isla, antes de la llegada de los españoles, solían vivir en cuevas naturales, formadas por las erupciones volcánicas que dieron origen la las Islas Canarias.
Ahora usted también  puede hacerlo con todas las comodidades del siglo XXI.
