hosts.about: I own a concert production company in Austin Texas (nomad sound inc) and travel as a live sound engineer.  I've traveled in Europe for work and fun more than 20 trips over the past 10 years, and have been to every US state except South Dakota and Alaska.  Of course I like live music, but actually prefer a bit of quiet time to read and relax with a good coffee. Part of what I love about ABNB is the chance to peek into other peoples lives, and see what they experience as locals.  I'll always go native in terms of food, coffee, and music.  I love to share my knowledge of Austin as a local, and appreciate those who share the best of where they live as well.
Living at 2.5km (8450ft) above sea level in Colorado's gorgeous Rocky Mountains. Only 20 minutes from Boulder & 60 minutes from downtown Denver. Gold Hill is the centre of my universe!

I am a curious traveler with a love for culture & exploration. By day I am a barista at a local coffee shop- by night I surround myself with learning, personal projects, and art! I love to show my appreciation for a space by taking good care of it & it’s inhabitants. Thank you in advance for opening up your beautiful space for temporary travelers to relax in!
I'm from Boulder, Colorado. Lover of all things travel and outdoors

recent.comments: We had an amazing time experiencing life in this pristine setting and enjoying the earth ship would love to visit again!

items.comments: We had an amazing time experiencing life in this pristine setting and enjoying the earth ship would love to visit again!

A really awesome place to stay near Boulder, especially if you're into earthships. Very secluded and peaceful, but also relatively close to the city and lots of hikes. The one difficulty we had was spending enough time there with all there is to do in the area. Definitely recommend having 4WD/AWD though, even in the summer! The road at the end is very steep and bumpy.

What an otherworldly experience to stay on a beautiful mountain home. The home was very clean, comfortable, and jaw dropping gorgeous. Hosts are quick responders and super friendly. 

You’ll find inner peace, enjoy nature, and honestly probably won’t want to leave, and no one would hold it against you. 

Absolutely would come back and stay again!

We have seen earthships before but never stayed in one so this was something we always wanted to do. We had a special event in Boulder and this experience blended well with the other things going on. The special unique details of this home reflect a lot of hand crafted things that make it original and one of a kind. Michelle was very responsive to our needs and made sure that everything went smoothly.
Fantastic stay!  Loved everything about it and didn't want to leave.
Beautiful place beautiful location

Earthship is something I wanna try for a very long time. This experience is amazing. Really like how it designed and very comfortable to live. Michelle is very sweet and respond to my  question very quickly.

description.summary: A handcrafted Earthship, meticulously designed with local materials. A sustainable cob house built into an earthen mountain side with towering views of Sugarloaf mountain. Hundreds of acres of wilderness sprawl before the expansive south-facing glass facade lined with an indoor garden. You'll be secluded enough to walk around inside butt naked, sip on coffee, play in the mountains, dream, get lost in the Milky Way while soaking in a hot tub, and live fully!
description.space:
This unique handcrafted space is made to be one with earthiness of the mountains. With two indoor gardens (one edible), rainwater catchment system, glass facade, greywater recycling system, solar water heaters and natural rammed earth and earth cob walls which keep this sustainable home comfortable year around with passive solar design.

The main house comes with a queen bedroom, a twin sleeping loft, a concrete shower-bath, composting toilet, reading and movie space, gorgeous, unique kitchen, and of course, indoor gardens that Earthships are famous for. 

The straw-bale cabin features vaulted post and timber frame construction. Whilst there is an antique woodstove in this cabin, it is currently unusable at we’ve awaiting parts after a 170+ mile wind storm blew off the chimney. You’re still welcome to use the dry and I heated cabin as a changing room next to the  compact, outdoor, 3-person hot tub.
description.access: You can access any and all spaces
description.notes:
Please let us know how many guests will be in your party. We set up beds and provide towels only for the exact number of guests on the reservation. Given the layout of the house, an additional guest (for a total number of 4 with an inflatable mattress) takes up significant resources to set up and clean for, not to mention, we truck in half of our water, and our plumbing, septic, and composting toilet cannot handle a higher number of users. Hence there's a charge for a additional guests. We also need to know the exact number of guests visiting the property for insurance purposes. There is outside camera to dissuade guests from bringing pets or extra guests.

Thank you for being transparent about all the guests on your reservation.
description.neighborhood: There are only a handful of neighbors on this steep mountain road which will bring you to the heels of towering and majestic Sugarloaf mountain. There’s no cell reception, only super fast Starlink satellite WiFi. The Earthship is only 30 minutes into the mountains to downtown Boulder, 1 hour to Eldora ski resort, and 20 minutes to a historic town of Gold Hill. Plenty of mountain hikes dot the surrounding area.
description.transit:
Last 0.5 miles is an unpaved, steep, slippery and narrow mountain road. It is not maintained in the winter. It’s rough, and you will ABSOLUTELY need the right vehicle to make it up.

WINTER: You will NOT make it without an AWD/4WD SUV with good winter tires AND studded tires OR chains. You absolutely MUST carry snow chains for backup. Please rent a vehicle that comes with snow tires (Turo is a great place for that).  PLEASE BE AWARE THAT IT CAN BE DIFFICULT TO DRIVE IN WINTER CONDITIONS AND THAT YOU COULD GET STUCK IF SNOWY CONDITIONS AREN'T COMMON FOR YOU.

That last 0.5 mile is a real wild adventure. Don’t underestimate it. If you don’t feel comfortable, consider canceling your reservation. As a data point, only 2 people got stuck last year and at least 3 had to put on the chains on to make it up. Most of those guests had never driven in snow and were from southern states. If you're already comfortable with snowy driving, you'll probably wonder what all the hype is about. It’s possible. However, we'd rather be accused of over estimating the difficulty than underestimating it for those not familiar. With good attitude and determination, you’ll likely be ok. But again, not for the faint hearted. 

>>> If you get stuck unfortunately there’s no way for us to help you to get out. DO NOT bother our neighbors. They have no interest during weekends nor any of their free time during the week to be helping unprepared guests. You will have to go to the house, connect to wi-if to use your phone and call towing which will be more expensive than spending extra on the right rental vehicle or buying chains as we've advised.

Please consider all this before committing to a trip in winter conditions.  When is winter? This is Colorado! We’ve had snow in July! However, between Oct 1 - May 1st, you must arrive with an 4WD/AWD vehicle with winter tires and chains and/or studded snow tires. Please check the weather forecast too. Useful too for pre/post winter, storms prediction.

SUMMER: Due to the off-road nature of the last half mile, we still highly suggest only AWD/4WD SUVs.

To choose differently is at your own risk. And again, please do NOT bother our wonderful neighbors! Thanks!
description.interaction: I might not be there when you arrive, but if you need any help whatsoever I'll jump on a call or text to help you out
description.house_rules:
* Please NO shoes in the house. 

* Whilst we do allow children it’s important you know that there is ladder access to the loft where the twin bed is located. There is an additional ladder in the master bedroom to an unfinished room, and a ladder to an unfinished loft in the cabin. We do not take responsibility for ladder safety.

recent.comments: Perfect place to relax and have fun with your family.

items.comments: Perfect place to relax and have fun with your family.

We absolutely adored our stay at Chris's place. They offered lovely touches to welcome us into the space - including some local treats, coffee, and an in person (whoa!) "hello" to exchange keys. It was such a delight! The space was very cozy, comfortable, clean, and a perfect proximity to Sequim's charming town and the outdoor spaces we loved to explore. We loved it so much, we asked at the last minute to extend our stay by one more day. Thankfully, the space was available and Chris made it tremendously easy to adjust our reservation. We wish we could've stayed longer! Highly recommend.

just what we were looking for! private and out of town, great place to relax in the evening after adventuring. No TV or other tech distractions, which is what I want from a vacation. Great deal if you don't need a lot of indoor space for hanging out or a big kitchen area. Loved the fireplace and outdoor seating areas, as well as the extra bath hut.

had a great time for our trip to sequim & olympic national park! very peaceful, cozy, & convenient. Beth & Chris we're both very courteous and responsive when we had questions. couldn't have asked for a better stay!

Chris, thanks for hosting our family. The place was the perfect getaway. We loved the privacy, the fire pit, and room for the dog to run and explore safely. We will definitely be back when visiting the peninsula!!
Bought this stay as a gift for my 70 year old parents and they loved it! So unique and so close by to all the nature that the PNW has to offer. I now want to book a stay for myself!
Adorable place, perfect for a peaceful get away. Especially to be in nature.

description.summary:
500 square foot custom built Under Ground House which can sleep four people comfortably.  

Loft with extra sleeping and storage space along with two twin folding mattress and sleeping bags.

Heated floor in the bathroom

Walking distance to Sequim Bay State Park & Olympic Discovery Trail

Fire Pit

Limited Free WIFI access

Outdoor Shower Facility

Four Season Building (indoor fire’s and bunk beds)

Cannabis (420)  Friendly
description.space: We offer our guests half of an acre of privacy,  included is an extra shower facility and four seasons building (for year-round camp fires).  We also have a fire pit (wood provided) and open space for pets to roam freely.
description.access: Private entry located at the back of the property.
description.notes: Please note we share the back road with a private farm we must always yield traffic to them.
description.neighborhood: We live in a very safe neighborhood with plenty of space between us and our neighbors.  Located just across the street from Sequim Bay State Park please ask the host about walking access to the park.
description.interaction: Please check in at the main house upon arrival.
description.house_rules:
- No smoking inside the home smoking allowed outside
- No climbing on the house
- No RV/Trailer parking
- Please pick up after yourself (dishes, trash, laundry)
- Please read the blue binder about the little quirks of the house.
-Please notify host if you are arriving late on check in day.
- 1 extra guest allowed (extra fee)

name: The Glass House, Huaran, Sacred Valley, Cusco
title: Sacred Valley , Peru

gallery.caption: Large boulder in the living room.  The Glass House is Integrated into the side of the mountain.
Surrounded by nature with amazing views of the mountains!
Comfortable king bed and soft 100,% cotton bed linens

kitchen is well equipped with pots, pans, silverware, plates, cups, glasses, wineglasses, blender, toaster, French press and kettle.

We also offer complementary, coffee, tea, sugar, oil, salt and pepper.
Firewood stove will keep you warm!
Comfortable king bed and soft 100,% cotton bed linens

hosts.about: Gina and Adam, both coming from the United States, met in 2016 in the Sacred Valley in Huaran during a ceremony. Our son was born the following year and we made the decision to live as a family in Huaran. The Glass House is one of our first projects and as residents of the area for over five years we enjoy serving guests from around the world who are coming to experience the beauty and the majesty of Sacred Valley of the Incas.

recent.comments: Beautiful and tranquil place! Everything was very clean and the hosts were extremely helpful and communicative!

items.comments: Beautiful and tranquil place! Everything was very clean and the hosts were extremely helpful and communicative!

Con mi pareja estuvimos buscando por un tiempo un lugar para poder desconectarnos totalmente y poder avanzar nuestros trabajos con la tranquilidad de la naturaleza. El hogar de Adam fue lo que hemos estado buscando y mucho más ! Su cabaña, vistas, y la atención del señor Teodoro en todo momento fue lo que nos permitió disfrutar la estadía. Volvería en un futuro para disfrutar del lugar otra vez. 

Gracias !

Our stay at the glass house was amazing. It was really peaceful and was exactly as listed. Great place to stay in the valley and near attractions and places to eat. The house itself it’s an attraction. Gina was very nice and gave us directions and tips.

From the moment I spotted this listing I knew it was where we wanted to stay on this trip to the Sacred Valley. The Glass House is a beautiful, cozy, comfortable space to let your hair down and relax, nestled in the Andes with views and trees right out the window. Gina and Adam were extremely quick and helpful with their responses; not to mention very warm and kind. The kitchen is well equipped for cooking, the deck dreamy for enjoying your morning coffee, the bed and sofas super comfy. We loved waking up with a view of the trees and Andes  from the bedroom window. We hired Freddy as a driver and he was warm and kind and as a local, full of local tips and historical facts. We enjoyed a day trip to Maras y Moray with him. We 1000% recommend the Glass House and hope to return!
Pobyt jsme si velice užili, krásný dům v  klidném prostředí. Ideální na relax a cestování po okolí. Vše bylo čisté a hostitel vždy reagoval velice rychle na jakýkoliv dotaz.

Easily one of my favorite airbnb stays ever! We ended up staying here while we visited Machu Picchu, Ollayantambo, Moray, and many other great sights in the area. The house was very clean and was in the most quaint village. My only negative is that we only booked a couple of nights- if you are planning a trip to Peru, I highly recommend booking this!

This was hands down one of the best Airbnb experiences I've had so far. There is great attention to detail in every aspect of it, from the various amenities to the very helpful and responsive host. The house itself is stunning and has a very warm atmosphere. Even though we only stayed for 3 days, it felt like home from the moment we got there. Even though everything was great, I must add that comfort is what stood out the most due to the very cozy blankets and incredibly comfortable bed.

Thank you for the great experience!

description.summary: Unique studio loft right in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas !The house features a large boulder in the living room and is integrated into the side of the mountain, surrounded by nature with amazing views of the mountains . The perfect spot for a Macchu Picchu base !
description.space:
Beautifully designed with large windows and direct views of some of the most sacred mountains. The house features a wood fire stove, a large king bed and spa robes.

Hour and a half ride from Cusco airport, 50 min ride to Ollantaytambo station-train to Machupicchu. 25 min ride to Urubamba.

The house is part of a gated community with a security guard.
description.access:
Services offered 

Taxis 
Grocery shopping services
Restaurant recommendations
Cleaning services for extra fee
description.notes:
House is located in a gated community where there are three guard dogs  . They sometimes bark at strangers but are well behaved and are not aggressive.

The house is at a slight elevation requiring about 20 steps to get to the house.
description.neighborhood:
Located in beautiful Huaran, an off the beaten path community and one of the  up and coming destinations in the Sacred Valley. Huaran is known for its amazing  scenery and nice walks . 

In the heart of the Sacred Valley , making it a great spot to access the most visited sites such as Pisac , Moray, Maras, Chincheros, Ollantaytambo.

Between Calca and Urubamba

50 minute ride to Ollantaytambo station-train to Machupicchu 

Hour and half ride from Cusco airport
description.transit:
For your convenience, we have highly professional and reliable drivers on call at all times to take you to restaurants, market or sites .

If you feel adventurous and want to try local culture, use public transportation to go to the market, Urubamba or Pisac. 

Main road with access to local transportation just five minute walk from the house.
description.interaction: Gina and Adam are available throughout your stay.... anything you need send us a message . We do not live on premises but there is a full time guard  “Teodoro” at the complex.
description.house_rules: No parties, no pets, no smoking please.       Please keep noise down after 9pm

hosts.about: Write the book you want to read, build the place you want to visit. My passion is creating spaces for people to enjoy.

recent.comments: Very nice place

items.comments: Very nice place

Had a great time! Loved the hobbit houses and the game of thrones bathroom. The hosts helped us on many occasions and we're very responsive. Starting with using the pizza oven! Would highly recommend staying here.

I absolutely recommend staying here!!! Such a fun concept and it was so great meeting/hanging out with other travelers. The hot tub was fantastic, and the bathroom facilities were extremely clean. Stephen has done a great job with this place! Something to keep in mind, it is similar to camping, so plan accordingly. Pack towels if you’re able, although Stephen does have them available, clothes for a bonfire, etc. The pizza available is delicious, especially cooked in the wood oven!

We loved Stephen's place and would definitely return! Lots of common areas and plenty of options to keep warm, and a well equipped kitchen. We stayed as a couple and loved it, but it would have been even better if we went with a group I think as there were so many social areas!

Séjour atypique. Le logement correspond à la description. Il était très propre avec une bonne literie. c'était très calme et reposant. C'est super sympa de pouvoir acheter les pizzas et se les faire cuire dans le four à pizza. 
L'équipe est très sympa et disponible. 
Merci à vous tous

The place was peaceful and quiet. It was so cozy and cute. It looked exactly like the photos. It was amazing staying in a Hobbit Hut. I’m a big Lord Of The Rings fan. It was fantastic. I will definitely be staying there again. Stephen was an amazing host and was very helpful.

Such a unique, fun place to stay!  The bathroom/ shower area was pristine and new.  Stephen did a great job with creation of all of the glamping units.   Having a pizza oven and hot tub avails was also a plus.  We only stayed one night , but slept well and enjoyed walking in the area.  Loved our hobbit house!

description.summary:
Ever wondered what it would be like to live like a hobbit under ground? Our little, earth covered house is nice and toasty, sleeps up to 4 people (1 double bed, 1 day bed). Relax in our wood fired sauna & hot tub*, cook some pizza or fire up a BBQ in our outdoor kitchen area and toast some marshmallows on our firepits. There is a communal kitchen, toilet & shower units on site.

** 2 night minimum stay on weekends
description.space: Nested in the rolling hills of the central Mayo countryside  it is the ideal location to get away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Our hobbit huts are spacious and cosy with their green grass roofs, round windows and doors you will feel your in a different world. Sit outside and toast some marshmallows on the firepit, starglaze on a clear night, enjoy camping with all the comforts!
description.access:
** Hot tub is for Adults only, There is 1 hour slots available from 5pm to 10pm There is a sub charge of €20 per hut per hour slot. times can be booked in advanced or on the day.

To use the pizza oven we supply timber. We Have pizzas on our shop for €9 each. you can bring a premade pizza or make your own. 
Movie hall works via chromecast, download the  home app to operate from your device. 

Kitchen area is open all night, tea, coffee, cereals are available.

There is a toilet located near the huts and there is 2 shower and toilet blocks on site

we do not sell alcohol on site,  BYO policy :)
description.notes: Tv within the hut works via chromecast.
description.neighborhood: We are 5 minutes from the National Museum of Country life were you can also cycle or walk the Castlebar/Turlough Greenway. we are 25 minute drive to Westport or Ballina and 15 minutes from Foxford. there is a number of walking routes in the area with fantastic scenery
description.transit:
We are 35 minutes from Knock International Airport.

Castlebar is the nearest destination for Bus or Rail transport which is 6 miles away. For guest using public service we we provide a free shuttle service on request

recent.comments: Everything was as it was described and looked.  The property is along side a cemetery, which didn't bother us, but was a surprise.  Comfortable beds and well-equipped kitchen.  Would recommend!

items.comments: Everything was as it was described and looked.  The property is along side a cemetery, which didn't bother us, but was a surprise.  Comfortable beds and well-equipped kitchen.  Would recommend!

House was great and as described.  Host was very responsive and even came over to top off the hot tub for us while we were out.  House was a little difficult to find but that was really because Waze thought it was in the cemetery up the street.  There was some gas line work happening during our stay so the smell was a bit distracting, but overall it was a great getaway for our families.  Kids had lots of open space to run and the outdoor pavilion was great for hanging out.
We had a great weekend and had everything we needed for a stress free time!
Had a great weekend! Great experience at this place.

The Earth Home was a perfect place for a reunion with my college roommates. Ian's place is exactly as described/pictures show, though the pictures do not show & the listing does not list a dishwasher,there IS a diswasher!  I thought the home was going to be way out away from any other homes, so when I turned on the road I wasn't immediately looking for the drive.  However, Ian did send details on the exact location...my bad for not reading fully. The home is very private and immaculate. Some reviews have mentioned "bugs" and Yes, there are a few bugs but please keep in mind, this house is underground, there will be bugs but they are not going to take you away!  The home is conveniently located near Hocking Hills park as well as other recommendations from Ian.  You may find that just relaxing in the hot tub is all you need.  My entire group of 7 would stay again at the Earth Home. Thank you for the opportunity to stay in your unique home.

Great place to stay! Location was private and a close drive to Hocking Hill’s state park. The outdoor area was amazing! We were able to spend most of our time under the covered patio-even when it was raining! Inside was clean and modern. Would stay here again!

My family and I enjoyed staying at this lovely house for a weekend. It was a rainy weekend when we stayed, but the covered outdoor patio with the hot tub and fire pit allowed us to still be outside. We will definitely be coming back to stay again.

description.summary: Another Living The Dreams family-owned cabin: our Underground Earth Home is built into the side of a hill situated on a private 25-acre lot in Hocking Hills, Ohio. This newly renovated and open floor plan is perfect for a couples weekend or family getaway and the options for entertainment are endless!

description.summary:
Welcome to Anna's Historic Stone Cottage! The 110 year old cottage has been transformed into the perfect combination of romantic and rustic for a dream-worthy getaway. The 280sq ft cottage features stunning, panoramic views of the San Diego skyline while offering rooftop seating for sunrise and sunset viewing. The Cottage is conveniently located 20 minutes from the world famous San Diego zoo and most other must-see, tourist spots. 
Amenities for special occasions offered too. Check out our menu!
description.space: The Stone Cottage, once used as a potters studio over 100 years ago, has since been transformed into a romantic and picturesque property. With stone walls and rooftop seating, the cottage offers a rare experience combining rustic charm and enchanting views. The cottage exudes a historic essence that is hard to find these days. If you're looking for a modern property, the Stone Cottage is not for you. However, if you appreciate unique, historical dwellings that highlight the beauty of San Diego landscapes, the Stone Cottage will keep you coming back.
description.neighborhood: Historic and extremely quiet. Lots of trees and nature.
description.transit: Minutes away from downtown La Mesa which is a strip of restaurants and stores. Access to trolley station which can take you to down town San Diego.
description.house_rules: Please do not park in the lower driveway as it's used regularly by the homeowners and property maintenance personnel.

name: CHALÉ CAVERNA VELHO MONGE
title: Núcleo Rural Capoeira do Bálsamo, Brazil

location.address: Núcleo Rural Capoeira do Bálsamo, Distrito Federal, Brazil

recent.comments: Lugar muito bonito, nem parece q estamos em Brasília. A piscina e a vista são lindas

items.comments: Lugar muito bonito, nem parece q estamos em Brasília. A piscina e a vista são lindas

Foi uma estadia linda, apesar de curta e experienciamos uma chuva muito gostosa, aconchegante... infelizmente não usamos usamos piscina, mas o espaço conta com vários detalhes. Muitos objetos de decoração, viagens, místicos, cristais e um Buda bem na entrada saudando os visitantes. 
Hum... o perfume do lugar!! Tantas plantas e árvores do cerrado brasileiro.  
O lugar é muito perto da cidade, mas ao entrar no sítio a magia acontece, o puro silêncio. 
Um lugar ideal para um retiro, para praticar meditação, atenção plena. Eu e meu companheiro saímos com vontade de ficar. Indico e pretendo voltar.

Primeiro, destaco a gentileza e prontidão do Adriano. A casa fica em um local muito bonito e privativo.  Tem várias pracinhas muito charmosas e uma fogueira excelente. Adoramos a varanda também, super agradável. A piscina estava bem limpinha e foi um prazer observar, em árvores próximas, uma família fofíssima de sagüis. Minhas únicas observações são sobre a iluminação externa, que poderia ser mais forte, para aumentar a sensação de segurança. A outra coisa é que a parte interna da casa poderia receber alguns reparos, especialmente na parte elétrica. Mas foi uma experiência muito boa, um fim de semana com muita paz.
I love this place! It’s magical! And amazing host!!! Thank you.
Lugar lindo, encantador. O Adriano é muito gentil,extremamente atencioso,preocupado e fez toda a diferença. Voltarei mais vezes se Deus quiser.

Amei, uma experiência de imersão na natureza maravilhosa! 😍
Não tenho palavras pra descrever a energia do lugar! E tudo isso bem pertinho da gente em Brasília, nem dá pra acreditar. Voltarei mais vezes
Lugar é muito bonito. Bem rústico. O ideal é não ir em dias chuvosos.

description.summary:
A chácara velho monge é o lugar perfeito para aqueles que querem desconectar de Brasília, se sentindo no Goiás com a vantagem de estar a poucos minutos do centro da Capital.

É um espaço amplo que conta com o CHALE CAVERNA, uma forma inédita de arquitetura exótica, com a estrutura natural da pedra o chalé se torna uma mistura de caverna com casa.

Além desse espaço citado, a chácara conta com amplos espaços de grama, praças em pedra, uma PISCINA DE BORDA INFINITA INCRIVEL DE AGUA MINERAL.
description.space:
É uma chácara ampla integrada no cerrado, que é o encanto do lugar.
Possui várias praças no meio da mata,
sendo uma experiência de interação total com a natureza.
(O chalé não possui WI-FI, mas na piscina tem acesso à Internet***) 

Um refúgio  para pessoas que buscam isolamento e descanso em um lugar alternativo e simples, tendo em vista que o CHALE fica no meio da mata e colado numa pedra natural. Como consequência em  dias de chuva muito forte a pedra tende a escorrer água e molhar um pouco do chão do chalé.

É UM ESPAÇO APROPRIADO PARA EVENTOS DE ATE 10 PESSOAS.
- perfeito para quem gosta de acampar.
- ideal para fotos e Day use também


*LUGAR NÃO INDICADO PARA PESSOAS 100% URBANAS. 🦊🦨🦅🐸🐍🕸🕷🐝🐞🐜🐚🐒

Obs: 

**A chácara possui 3 chalés, no qual apenas o chalé caverna é alugado.

***Os outros 2 chalés eventualmente são ocupados pelos proprietários, porém o espaço é bem amplo e as casas ficam distantes e sem contato visual entre si, trazendo consigo privacidade e sensação de isolamento.
description.access: NÃO INDICADO PARA PESSOAS IDOSAS ANTE A ACESSIBILIDADE E A RUSTICIDADE DO LUGAR.
description.neighborhood:
SITUADO NO SETOR RURAL DO LAGO NORTE.
UM LUGAR DE PAZ E MUITA NATUREZA.
description.transit: transportes de aplicativos  no geral chegam na chácara velho monge, mas para pedir de lá muitas vezes o motorista do aplicativo não aceita.

hosts.about: We are Jo and Kevin, we have been married for over 50 years and have 5 kids, 15 grandkids, 23 great grandkids, we have 1 dog, Brutus. We are inviting you here to share in our unique, unusual lifestyle and enjoy the peace, quiet and the beauty of the Mohave desert.

recent.comments: Jeanette is an awesome host.  The cave was just amazing. Views were spectacular!  Highly recommend staying here.

items.comments: Jeanette is an awesome host.  The cave was just amazing. Views were spectacular!  Highly recommend staying here.

La maison-grotte de Jeanette et Kevin est un endroit extraordinaire et une expérience hors du commun qu'on vous conseille vivement. L'accueil est fabuleux, leur histoire incroyable. Le couple a creusé et decoré leur grotte pendant 20 ans. C'est très joli et chaleureux. Ils nous ont fait la visite de leur propriété en 4x4. C'était magique.

We absolutely loved our stay, definitely will be back. The view is amazing, love the history and dedication Jo & Kevin have put into the place. We felt so at home. Love the uniqueness about the place. The kids Absolutely loved it and our son especially enjoyed climbing the mountains and exploring but not sitting on the cactus too much!!! 😂😂

Awesome, awesome, awesome!!!!! Is the best way I could describe our stay.  I traveled from Vegas with my 5 year old grandson and decided to spend a couple nights, because we wanted to spend a day exploring the Grand Canyon. Jeanette's Cave was the perfect experience for us.  How often do you get to spend a night in a cave with real beds?  It was great, there was so much on the property for us to explore.  Only downside, it was HOT outside, so we waited until the evening to explore, but not to worry there is so much to do inside as well.  We played darts and foos ball, and she had tons of toys and movies that kept my little one very occupied. And I can't forget about Brutus (the family dog), he kept my grandson occupied too and he is so sweet and friendly.  

They had all the amenities we needed and even provided a few snacks, water, coffee and sodas. I will definitely be coming back.  It was an experience we will always remember!!  Thank you Ms Jo & Mr Kevin, ya'll are wonderful host!!
This was such an amazing stay, I'll be coming back asap! The history, the host, and the vibes were right up my alley. This place felt like a home away from home.

Man. All I can say is WOW! Our stay with Jo & Kevin at Cave Inn was one I’ll never forget. It was the perfect way to spend my birthday weekend with my best friend and her little, Baby Ro Ro! I didn’t want to leave. The cave, the history, the character and peaceful, desert vibes were just what my soul needed. PLENTY of room in the 6,000+ sqft space with everything we needed. Jo & Kevin were the coolest and kindest hosts and I’m so glad we got to spend our stay with them. I definitely recommend Cave Inn if you’re looking for an escape from the city life. What an interesting and awesome way to live. Can’t wait to go back! Thanks again for sharing your space with us, Jo & Kevin! 🫶🏼🧊🌵

The CAVE INN is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. Words cannot describe how gorgeous it is. Jo and her family treat you like you are family and go out of their way to elevate your stay. Jo was also able to answer a lot of my questions about the surroundings as well as intertwining family history. We got to meet Jo's great-grandson who was a cool kid and helped me start a fire for some spores. Cannot recommend it enough!

description.summary:
Welcome to Taylor Mountain Cave Inn Retreat!! 
Looking for a little bit of "Adventure"? Inside this unique Cave House, in an unusual setting off the beaten path, you'll have an unforgettable experience of a lifetime! We have 100+  
acers of rugged desert terrain with hiking trails and cool old time mining equipment to see, like our 1890s Stamp Mill.  Have an ATV?  Bring it and venture off on your own. We are centrally located 1.5 hours from Las Vegas, NV,  Laughlin, NV and Grand Canyon West, AZ,
description.space:
The cave was a 20-year DYI project, built by my husband and I, with the help of our kids and a few friends (ask to see the home video). There is more than enough space to share, so we want others to experience this unique retreat.  In this 6,000 sq ft cave, my husband and I reside in the front half, as we are here to ensure everything runs smoothly during your visit.  I mean it is a cave, we run off of solar and generator power, our water is welled, so we work to conserve our resources.  

With that said, here are some things to note.  We are about 6 miles off the main road, so allow yourself 30 additional minutes of travel time to get to the cave.  The road is bumpy, but definitely drivable.  Arrangements can be made for those not sure your vehicle can make it (EV's). This is the perfect place to disconnect, we have Wi-Fi, but it some areas of the cave, there's no service. You'll be too busy exploring and being entertained to notice.
Also, we turn the main generator to the cave off when our guests turn-in for the night, so please plan to charge your devices in advance. You won't be completely in the dark as we have motion censored lights throughout. Also, we have a family dog name Brutus. He loves our guests and welcomes your fur babies as well.  His enters and exits through his dog door at the back of the cave so we hope that's not a problem and we can fix that if neccessary. 

Your living space....has its own separate entrance in the rear of the cave, it can sleep up to 6 comfortably, with 1 shared bathroom, located in one of the main sleeping areas.  The space is for your party only, so even if there is only one or 2 of you have the space to yourself.  It comes fully equipped, with mini-fridge, toaster oven, microwave and coffee maker (coffee, snacks, water and condiments provided). There's a propane BBQ grill area and firepit located just outside your entrance (you'll need to bring your own wood though).  Please note:  wind conditions may prevent use of firepit, we are on a mountain top. For your entertainment there's Foos ball, darts, horseshoes, hiking, not to mention great sunsets and star gazing.  For young kids we have tons of toys in the library, so they are sure to stay entertained. Coming soon will be a campsite for those of you who want to sleep under the stars.  It's always fun to walk through the bone yard never knowing what strange things you'll see there. Also, The Museum at the Top of the Hill with the 1890s stamp mill and various mining equipment.
description.access: My husband, and I live here in the Cave and will be here to make sure all things run smoothly, as living entirely off grid is quite complicated. There is a huge space in the back (the game room/common sleeping area) for your enjoyment. We do have TV's and classic movies for the kids to enjoy as you unwind for the night.
description.notes: Please be aware that the 6- mile primitive dirt road takes at least 25 to 30 minutes from the pavement to the Cave Inn and it is drivable.  Excess rain can wash out the road and fill up washes making it difficult to make it to and from the paved road (luckily, we don't get much rain).  Dolan Springs has a couple of restaurants, a few little shops, a VFW, a post office, a Family Dollar, Dollar General and Dolan Station with gas, groceries and alcohol. It would be wise to buy your previsions before heading up the dirt road, you won't want to drive back down to the store! Any questions, please don't hesitate to ask.  We want you to get the best out of your Cave experience.  Don't want to drive your car up, again that's not a problem, we can work out arrangements for transportation.  We also have plenty of space, so if you have a group larger than 6, please message me directly and we can discuss.
description.neighborhood: We are located 6 miles up a primitive dirt road, and most car have no problem. Many types of cars and motorcycles, including our 97 Harley have made that journey many times.  But arrangements for pickup and delivery at 8435 W 7th Street Dolan Springs, AZ can be arranged. Very secluded our nearest neighbor is about 2 miles away. What happens at the Cave... You never know...
description.transit: The city of Dolan Springs is 7 miles away,  I highly recommend Canyon Café restaurant, good food, fast, friendly service. Hot Diggity Dog, also serves breakfast a Family Dollar and Dollar General stores, other shops and Dolan Station for gas, beer and wine, groceries. and a deli, a VFW, and an American Legion.
description.interaction: The Cave Inn welcomes you to experience a totally off grid lifestyle, which makes it very complicated. Therefor it is imperative that myself and my husband are here to make sure your stay is comfortable, fun, pleasant and worry free.
description.house_rules:
#1 Be conscious of water conservation. Our water comes fron a well. Please don't allow faucets to run when not in use.
#2 We are completly off the grid and and get our eletricty from solar, wind and back up generator, which comes on at around 7am and off at around 10pm. How long the power stays on depends on usage, please don't leave lights, TVs etc. left on when not in use.
#3 We have many very old items in or around our property that may look like trash to someone else or already be damaged but still have value. Please have respect and care of it's contents

description.summary: The Honeymoon Trail Inn provides a themed suite and fully-sculpted environment that will remove you from today's active lifestyle and transport you to a private oasis in the desert. The Honeymoon Trail Inn is the perfect place to begin a honeymoon, celebrate a special anniversary or enjoy time away from home.

hosts.about: Holiday Rental will always provide you with an extraordinary luxury vacation experience. Our stunning Scottsdale, Arizona villas are handpicked to meet your every need, whim, and desire. Like our properties, our service and attention to detail are unrivaled. With our luxurious homes and elite guest services, we promise that your stay with us will truly exceed your expectations!

recent.comments: Best view & pool ever

items.comments: Best view & pool ever
Spectacular home and views.  Our family had the most relaxing, wonderful vacation.

On The Rocks is a fabulous house to rent.  Plenty of room for a large group not only for sleeping but also if you want some quiet time for yourself.  Numerous TV's, putting/chipping green, horseshoes, corn hole and the pool/hot tub, there is no reason to have to leave to do anything else.  Owls and hawks will keep you very occupied as well as the sunsets you will experience.  On The Rocks has something for everyone.  Holiday Rental personnel are very professional and timely addressing issues that arise during your stay.  I would definitely look to use them again when looking to rent a house for a future vacation.

Stunning views!  Incredibly designed house!  We had an amazing family reunion weekend over President's Day.  The room configuration doesn't exactly match the listing but we made it work.  Definitely check out the listing on their own website for more complete details.  The views from the house are literally in every direction.  The front and back sides of the house received plenty of sunshine throughout the day.  We had our very own yoga session on the backyard.  They have an amazing outdoor grilling area right near the pool that we took advantage of, though, it could use more lights.  It was a bit too cold to fully enjoy the fire pits but they were gorgeous when lit.  Be wary of the horseshoe pit and getting down there.  The cornhole was a ton of fun!  The staff were incredibly responsive and helped attend to every detail throughout our stay, including letting us know where they buy their mattresses...every bed was very comfortable!
Stunning location and prompt and attentive service!  Perfect for a group get away!
Amazing place. Very open and a great spot for a large family or a small corporate retreat.

• A signed rental agreement is required to book this home  

• NO bachelor parties, weddings, or other events are allowed  

• Standard occupancy is limited to 12 guests - each additional guest up to maximum occupancy of 14 guests is $100 more per person per night  
Exceeding maximum occupancy without prior approval will result in an additional $250 per person per night

• No loud noise after 9 pm. Violation could result in removal without refund.  

• A valid credit card is required for all incidentals   

• Cancellation of a reservation will result in a loss of all rents paid   

• Reservations are non-refundable  

After you book, you will send us your personal email address so we can send you our rental agreement. We will collect a credit card and ID to place on file. In order for us to verify your identity, we must collect a CC. You are agreeing to submit ALL of this information to us after you book. Also, the agreement must be signed within 24 hours of booking.

hosts.about:
I am a photographer living with my husband and child in Rio de Janeiro. Both my husband and I are artists; both of us are very passionate about visual art (photography, painting and sculpture). We both live about an hour outside of Rio, in the Petropolis area, which is a natural reserve with lush tropical rain forest and mountains. 

My web page is www.isidoragajic.com

We have traveled all over the world, but have a special love for Portugal, France, Japan, and Latin America.

recent.comments:
A casa é ainda mais mágica do que nas fotos. Extremamente privada, muita luz natural, linda vista, energia boa e com arquitetura e decoração elegantes, com muita madeira e concreto.
A casa estava limpa e muito bem cuidada pelos caseiros Carminha e Sérgio, que foram dois amores, tanto no check in quanto quando precisamos de ajuda para regular o gás do chuveiro. Adoramos o fato de a casa não ter wifi nem sinal de celular, mas que há wifi na casa dos caseiros, há poucos minutos, em caso de alguma emergência. (Por favor, não coloquem wifi! hehehe)
O ofurô na varanda é especial, mas realmente demora muito pra encher (contamos 3 horas e meia), único ponto a melhorar. As toalhas, roupas de cama e cobertores são ótimos, há varios utencílios úteis de cozinha, sentimos falta de mais talheres. O chuveiro é quente, boa pressão de água e muito gostoso. A experiência foi maravilhosa, a casa e o lugar são muito especiais, definitivamente recomendo e voltaria!

items.comments:
A casa é ainda mais mágica do que nas fotos. Extremamente privada, muita luz natural, linda vista, energia boa e com arquitetura e decoração elegantes, com muita madeira e concreto.
A casa estava limpa e muito bem cuidada pelos caseiros Carminha e Sérgio, que foram dois amores, tanto no check in quanto quando precisamos de ajuda para regular o gás do chuveiro. Adoramos o fato de a casa não ter wifi nem sinal de celular, mas que há wifi na casa dos caseiros, há poucos minutos, em caso de alguma emergência. (Por favor, não coloquem wifi! hehehe)
O ofurô na varanda é especial, mas realmente demora muito pra encher (contamos 3 horas e meia), único ponto a melhorar. As toalhas, roupas de cama e cobertores são ótimos, há varios utencílios úteis de cozinha, sentimos falta de mais talheres. O chuveiro é quente, boa pressão de água e muito gostoso. A experiência foi maravilhosa, a casa e o lugar são muito especiais, definitivamente recomendo e voltaria!
Casa exatamente como descrita no anúncio, com muitos utensílios e coisinhas para deixar a estadia mais agradável! O ambiente é ótimo e o por do sol maravilhoso!

A casa é simplesmente sensacional, sem palavras para descrever a energia do local. 
Isolado da cidade, sem ninguém ao redor e uma vista para o vale que não dá vontade de parar de olhar. A casa é super confortável e, mesmo no frio, ela conserva bem o calor recebido ao longo do dia. A Isidora nos disponibilizou lenha suficiente para fazermos um calor a noite e mantermos aquecidos. Outro excelente ponto é que o terreno dá acesso a uma cachoeira para um bom banho, a pouco tempo de caminhada da casinha. 
O Ofurô tem uma água bem quente e é confortável, porém a vazão da água é muito baixa e demora pra encher. 
Pontos positivos: conforto, isolamento, paz
Pontos de melhoria: apesar de muitos procurarem pelo isolamento, falta internet para uma eventualidade. Uma tv também seria bom para assistir a filmes ou séries.

O nosso final de semana foi absolutamente ma-ra-vi-lhoso. A casa é mais linda ainda que nas fotos e tem tudo o que você precisa para umas férias perfeitas; redes, jacuzzi, vistas incríveis, churrasquinho… . A gente só ficou 2 dias mas com muita vontade de extender ♥️ voltaremos logo!

A Isidora foi super solícita e atenciosa, os caseiros Jorge e Carminha, foram muitos simpáticos, a estrutura da cabana é ótima, pra relaxar e curtir mesmo.
A estrada de terra que dá acesso a cabana é um pouquinho difícil, mas nada que prejudique a viagem, vale a pena a ida.

Nossa estadia foi perfeita! Realmente a estrada de terra é um pouco mais complicada de chegar mesmo, mas compensa pela privacidade e contato com a natureza. O caseiro nos recebeu super bem e se colocou à disposição caso precisássemos de algo. Aproveitamos muito e recomendo bastante!
Lugar perfeito! As fotos nao traduzem a beleza e charme do local e decoracao. Uma experiencia incrivel e 100% desconectado da vida normal.  Super recomendo

description.summary:
A place where you can truly disconnect from the world and reconnect with yourself/others.
In Vale das Videiras designed by the Brazilian artist , with a unique architecture where the home is built into the mountain side rock. It is extremely quiet here. The home has full views of the surrounding valley, which has lush tropical greenery.
There is NO WiFi or cell reception here. You can only connect with yourself, your travel partners and the nature around you.
description.space: Important to know that the bedrooms are very close to each other as the home is one large space. You must feel close with those who are traveling with you to share this space.
description.access: A river with clean running water, as well as a beautiful green valley is part of the property. Feel free to explore.
description.notes: You will feel a calmness and peace you never felt before. And the journey there will be worth it.
description.neighborhood: Vale das Videiras
description.transit:
To get here, you will need to have a car. And please purchase groceries on the way to the property from the nearby village (a short 10 min drive).

We can also arrange transportation for you (to and from Rio or Rio airport) for an additional fee. On your way you can pick up some groceries. Please contact me prior to your arrival and we can arrange it.

IMPORTANT: to note that there is a part of the road which is off road. Please make sure you have a car that can suit the road. Thank you!
description.house_rules: Não pode fazer fogo na varanda ou perto da casa.

hosts.about: Whether it’s a couples’ retreat, a weekend away with friends or an important family event, Waterfall Caves caters for every occasion. Our accommodation comprises underground caves with a hot tub, wooden chalets and a traditional cottage to rest and relax. Enjoy stunning panoramic views of the captivating mountains and countryside that surround Waterfall Caves.

recent.comments: The most beautiful stay I have had in a long time! We cannot wait to come back!

items.comments: The most beautiful stay I have had in a long time! We cannot wait to come back!

Absolutely loved our stay here... ended up disappointed we had only booked the one night! Lovely space, very relaxing. Paula was so chatty and welcoming when we arrived and offered to order some Chinese or Indian food if we wanted, but we had already done a food shop (or we would have definitely taken advantage). The caves are in close proximity to each other, but everyone said a friendly hello and then left each other to enjoy their privacy. Cannot fault the faclities at all, very clean and well maintained. Will definitely return, and 100% recommend it to others!
Fantastic 🤗Thank you 😊

They aren’t kidding when they call this an area of great natural beauty. The green hills and mountains and the seaside make this an amazing place to spend any amount of time.  Paula and family make your stay amazing- from having a fire ready to go, to robes for the hot tub and fishing rods you can borrow to try to do some trout fishing. Couldn’t have picked a nicer place to spend an evening.

Really lovely experience , relaxing but with lots to do at same time. 
Fishing and buggy ride were fab. 
We will Be back

La grotte dans laquelle nous avons séjourné était juste parfaite: situation idéale pour profiter de la route vers la chaussée des Géants, vue sublime , logement cosy qui permet en même temps de profiter de la nature environnante. Un bijou

While the cave apartment itself was great, we did not realize that it was part of a campground. If you are looking for a private romantic place to stay this is not it. The pond outside of the cave had kids and campers fishing and running around. The hot tub is shared and you must reserve a time. I think it would be nice if the hot tub had a privacy fence around it as you are open to the lake with the campers. I imagine it could be nice when not as many are there camping. 
Ross was very nice and helpful when we arrived. Great personality to greet you.

description.summary:
Underground quirky accommodation on the shores of Duncrun Fishing Lakes. 
Private fishing lakes on location beside Binevenagh Mountain and forest. Walking trails from cottage with waterfalls and natural springs. Game of Thrones filming location within walking distance. Unique living space – one of a kind in Northern Ireland. Prime location on the Causeway Coastal Route, close to Giant’s Causeway, Bushmills Distillery, Benone Beach, Mussenden Temple, Hezlett House, Roe Valley Country Park.
description.notes: As the caves are situated close to lakes , all children under 16 must be a ccompanied by an adult at all times. The surrounding lakes and walkways have a strict no alcohol policy .

hosts.about: A joiner and building contractor, working in the local area for 40years. Married to Caroline, head teacher in a Oban primary school, we have brought up 4 children in the area ,in 2020 the eldest was 25 and the youngest 18, some of whom help us run the facilities here at Cuan. Along with ourselves they realise how special this area is with its wildlife and ever changing environment. We hope you appreciate it also

recent.comments:
We stayed here with our kids aged 8,6 and 2. The location is absolutely stunning, peaceful and unspoilt. Great base for kayaking (spotted lots of seals!), beachcombing, fishing. The kids loved exploring the natural environment and spotting wildlife. Loads to see and do in the surrounding area. 
The cave is compact but with very well equipped kitchenette, warm shower and wc, everything you need.
With 3 kids we did wimp out of going completely ‘off grid’ so got an EE SIM which had usable 4G reception, could download films etc.
We had excellent detailed directions and local info from our hosts.
Highly recommend and we would love to return. 
We divided our holiday between the two caves, this review applies equally to both.

items.comments:

Beautiful location and base for touring. The cave is well equipped, tidy and easy to use with a wonderful outlook.

Basic verblijf in een tiny house. Geweldige lokatie met mooie zichten. Een rustige en minder toeristische streek van Schotland, die toch zeker de moeite waard is voor een verblijf. Vele mooie eilandjes. Wat minder evident om wandelingen te vinden.

The cabin was fully equipped, clean and a lovely outside area. The advice and instructions to what was available around the area was fantastic and we took the opportunity to visit most on the list. No data signal but that only added to the enjoyment of being away and spending time together

Mooie omgeving erg vrij. 

Het bed is te kort voor iemand van 1.80 meter.
Tremendous outlook to the inlet,  the cave pod was well designed with shelves exactly where you needed them.

A beautiful location for a peaceful break. It had everything you could need and the information from the host was useful. We enjoyed watching the seals and the sun set while having a glass of wine. Close to the ferry if you want to wander across to the next island and explore. Would recommend to anyone wanting to switch off for a while.  Perfect sea access for kayaks but worth noting it's a fast flowing stretch of water so wouldn't risk paddleboards.

description.summary: Cuan Cave  is set on the shores of Cuan Sound, it is the ideal location for kayakers, walkers and those wishing to enjoy the peaceful surroundings. Carsaig Cave, along with Alexandra Lifeboat, Mary Heather Lifeboat, Cuan Bunkroom and small campground  are part of the facilities we provide here on  Argyll's rugged coastline.
description.space:
Cuan cave gives you the unique opportunity to stay in a cave, formed into the shoreline on  the edge of clan sound, with all facilities to hand. Formed into the curved shapes are a double berth sleeping area and a double bunk that can be changed to a settee with table in the entrance/ activity area, all with views down the bay to the sea, or the stars at night through the roof lights.
We do not provide any linen, and due to the current circumstances, we encourage guests to provide their own. However, if requested we can provide a pillow, sleeping bag with liner and a towel for £7/person for 2 nights.
The galley kitchen has breakfast bar with stools, plenty storage space with cooking and eating utensils. There is a fridge, double hob, microwave, kettle, toaster and George Foreman grill, (or equivalent ). Set in the back of the cave, accessed through a sliding door is a quadrant corner shower, wash basin and W.C with the luxury of underfloor heating.
There is also an outdoor seating area with fire pit and wood available.
description.access: Cuan Cave is situated  at the edge of the bay on the shores of Cuan Sound and is part of our Argyll Kayaker Cove, along with Carsaig Cave,Alexandra Lifeboat, Mary Heather Lifeboat, Cuan Bunkroom and small campground  forming part of the facilities we provide here for accommodation. There is   access to the rugged Argyllshire coastline with stunning views and opportunities for exploration. As a designated marine area of scientific interest, there is an abundance of wildlife and nature to be enjoyed, from seals and dolphins to otters and sea eagles!
description.notes:
We do not provide linen. Due to the current circumstances we encourage you to provide your own. However, if requested we can provide a sleeping bag with liner, pillow and a towel for £7/person for two nights.
You will no doubt get to meet our collie Cuan. Whilst we readily accept pets we have now had a number of guests that have abused the situation and facilities, therefore we hope you can understand why we now ask for a small contribution towards the additional cleaning, £5 for a night.

Considering that  Cuan Cave is part of a small campground, if your journey dictates that you will be arriving late please be considerate of other guests.
description.neighborhood: Cuan Sound is a tidal stretch between the Islands of Luing and Seil which connects two very unique island communities, both of which are incredibly vibrant and welcoming, and offer a range of different activities. The Island of Luing - the home of the famous Luing cattle breed and slate quarries "which roofed the world"- is only a short ferry ride away and hosts the  Atlantic islands Centre, a cafe and museum full of stories and history of the surrounding islands!  ( opening may be restricted due to current C19 restrictions)This is a perfect base to take a boat trip, cycle ride around the Island of Luing, or walk round the shoreline, if you are not a kayaker yourself! There are also a variety of lovely pubs and cafes in the area if you fancy a more relaxed  excursion.
description.transit:
Approximately 30 minutes drive from Oban to Cuan Cave. A few miles after you have crossed the "Bridge over the Atlantic" onto the Isle of Seil you will come a cross roads, which is a tight right hand bend  with 2 left turns, go straight on and follow public road B8003 to Cuan Ferry and Isle of Luing, as you drop down the hill into Cuan ferry you will see a kayak with signage on your right directing you over a cattle grid. Follow this signage and drive down towards the bay, the track splits and take the left track with sign pointing to Cuan Bunk room There is parking and turning just in front of the entrance door to the bunk room.
There are also 5 buses serve Cuan Ferry from Oban , between 9 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon.
description.interaction: We live in Cuan House, just up the track from the bay. We like to give our guests space to enjoy the peace and tranquillity of the area but are on hand to answer any questions or provide advice on things to do and see locally if requested.
description.house_rules: The Cave is part of a campsite, we therefore ask for quite by 2200hrs

hosts.about:
Paradise Retreats - World Class Vacation Rentals

Paradise Retreats offers unsurpassed service to Guests and Owners of the vacation homes we represent.  Our properties are beautiful and well-maintained, and have all the amenities you would expect in a luxury home.

We specialize in satisfying the needs of the discriminating customer, who expects the best in service and quality.  Each of our properties offers a unique and special experience.

Please contact us with any questions or inquiries.

recent.comments: It was so amazing. My two boys and my husband loved the whale house.   It was clean and cozy. Every room and spots were great. It is expensive house but it is worth. I will bring my parents in next time. The place is near the beach and downtown and highway. So it was a perfect place for our president day’s weekends. Thank you 🙏🏻

items.comments: It was so amazing. My two boys and my husband loved the whale house.   It was clean and cozy. Every room and spots were great. It is expensive house but it is worth. I will bring my parents in next time. The place is near the beach and downtown and highway. So it was a perfect place for our president day’s weekends. Thank you 🙏🏻

I booked the whale house for a birthday weekend for my 7-year-old daughter along w/ a few family members. Her first reaction when I showed her the pictures was "How did you know I always wanted to stay a whale house?!" When we arrived we were not disappointed. The kids had a great time exploring all the unique features of the house. You should know that each bedroom is on a different level of the structure and that the stairwell is exposed to the outside and is a bit of a climb, but that was of no problem to us. The house is a few minutes from the Botanical Gardens and 10 minutes to downtown, so the location was pretty central despite being in the foothills. We loved our experience and it will remain highly memorable!

This is the most unique house we have ever stayed in.  The overall house was so fantastic and fun.  The location of the house is so close to everything.  The Whale House is a great place to stay in Santa Barbara.  Overall our stay was comfortable and we had a ton of fun.  The front door had a little trick to get into with wiggling the kay, but other than that, it was a flawless stay.

Our stay at The Whale House was all that we could have hoped for. This unique home is something that needs to be seen in person to get the full grasp of what it took to imagine and build. The house itself is getting a little old. There are features that were built into the home which are either not working, capped off, or removed. The elevator was reported to not work in the home but we were able to find the issue ourselves and it turned out to work just fine, making moving amongst the 4 floors much easier. There are latches in the bathroom which the crews were stripped out so locking the door was not an option. The Suana is no longer a part of the home. As for the house itself, it was clean upon arrival. Ben was easy to reach by phone and walked us through the entire home and answered all my questions. 

Downsides:
If you plan to cook for more than a couple people, this home may not be your best option. The "stove" is a two burner stove and the oven has no instructions leaving it all but useless. It's an Italian brand, I think so even looking it up online wasn't an option. 
besides what I mentioned above, the house real did meet our expectations.

Great house for adventurous kids...and adults :) kids were happy to explore. Pool was a great hit, it was so warm, that we spent time in it several hours despite cold weather. Owner company was great.

As the reviews indicate this is an amazing house especially for those who are fans of Gaudí. After some time there you start to feel as if the house is alive. The outdoor pool, spa and bathtub are great for relaxation. The fireplaces are also fantastic for staying warm and enjoying a good bottle of wine and conversation. Only things to consider are the stove top which is small and we had issues with the elevator. Other than that we would go back and thoroughly enjoyed our stay!
Loved it.

description.summary:
The Whale House - Unique Architectural Masterpiece in Mission Canyon

Built in 1978, this artful expression of one man's vision blends design, nature's beauty, and a clever sense of humor!  Inspired by the fanciful creations of renowned Architect Antonio Gaudi, Michael Carmichael (Architect and original owner/builder) let his imagination run wild.  The result, one of the most awe-inspiring, mind-boggling homes in America!  The story begins, "...and then, the whale swallowed the entire ship!" The rest is pure hand-made artisan and architectural genius! 

The layered shingled exterior of the home indeed resembles a whale. Four stories high, each varying level reveals amazing craftsmanship, coupled with luxury appointments the discriminating traveler expects. Undulating walls of Venetian plaster, river rock, massive wood columns and beams, and a whopping 270 Belgian leaded and stained glass windows, are the structural art by which the home is defined. 

The inner courtyard is the heartbeat of this majestic creature, where a 75-foot glistening lap pool magically flows into the tail of the whale - the detached Guest House.  Around this inner sanctuary are lush plantings, luminescent lighting, shady oaks, and an enclosed outdoor shower. 

On the 2nd Floor, and overlooking the pool below, the well-equipped Kitchen, Living Room and Dining Room, all connect in a 360-degree circle. Access all four floors from the winding entry courtyard stairwell that is open to the sky above. 

On the 3rd Floor, the Master Suite with king-size bed features a jetted spa tub in the room, a sitting area, and balcony that overlooks the pool. From here, a door leads right into the red tile shower in the Master Bathroom, crazy cool! For a working professional, perch at the high-top table, and bring a laptop to create a tree house working environment high above seasonal Mission Creek below.

On the 4th Floor, a light-filled Suite offers a queen-size bed, and a twin day bed. Another lovely Bathroom, with tall windows and a claw foot tub, feels like bathing while cradled in the branches of the surrounding oaks and sycamores.  

When it comes to spending time outdoors, the choices - like the number of shingles on The Whale House - are endless. Without a doubt the interior courtyard is the heart of the home, but also the well lit front patio is a tranquil spot to enjoy the natural surroundings and peaceful setting. Prepare a barbecue feast and dine al fresco or simply relax and unwind under a large market umbrella offering shaded seating. 

Mission Canyon is a magical wooded neighborhood, yet only minutes from beloved attractions like the Santa Barbara Mission and Rose Garden, with the energy of downtown nearby. It is an easy 5-minute walk to the Santa Barbara Botanic Gardens just up the street, or join locals on nearby trails that wind into the foothills, ending in spectacular coastal views that are not to be missed. 

Be a part of a historical voyage that many artists, celebrities, writers, and musicians have all enjoyed over the years, in a beloved home that few can resist. As one can imagine, a stay at The Whale House will be a once in a lifetime experience!  Climb aboard!

hosts.about:
Je voyage seule, avec mon mari ou avec mes 2 enfants. 
Nous sommes une famille calme, respectueuse des logements que nous occupons.

40 ans, Positif, Spontané, Féru d’histoire, de géo, de golf, de voyages, j'aime les déserts & le bon vin. Attiré par les interactions  humaines, les partages, les lectures et les réflexions. 
Entier,je vais au bout des choses & je ne les fais jamais à moitié. 
Je reçois de façon cool, chaleureuse, informelle & authentique!

recent.comments:
Une vue époustouflante !!!
Un grand merci a milouda, championne de ping ping😁😁
😍👍

items.comments:

😍👍

Cet endroit doit rester secret !
Nous avons passé 1 semaine chez Mika avec nos 4 enfants et nous savons déjà que nous y reviendrons . 
C’est exactement ce que nous recherchions . Une plage quasi deserte , un spot éloigné de l’agitation touristique , la possibilité de pêcher, surfer , nager , admirer le coucher du soleil , danser autour d’un feu le soir sur la plage et une cuisinière adorable Milouda qui s’occupe de tout !! Des vrais vacances reposantes ! 
Un énorme merci à Mika pour ta disponibilité et tes conseils avisés .

This is a one-of-a-kind Airbnb spot! Located on a beautiful beach, off the main roads and touristic hot spots, its troglodyte set up adds to its magic. If you like unconventional houses, delivering above expectations on the peacefulness, stunning sunset, fresh fish, delicious tajine cooked by Milouda… this has to be a place you visit at some point! It may not have all the comfort of a regular hotel room but guess what… this is SO not what we were looking for. So THANK YOU so much Mika for being such a great host, always available and friendly. We loved it all the way!!
Le logement est dans un environnement exceptionnel face à la mer. Mika est très réactif pour résoudre les problèmes éventuels.

We had an amazing stay at Mika's. Being steps from the Atlantic Ocean was nothing short of spectacular. Swimming and surfing was great and we hired a live in assistant to cook for us while we were there - well worth the small price. Mika was very responsive and helpful in getting things booked for us locally while we were there and when our daughter got sick, he was so helpful in making sure we had everything we needed to get her better. Had an amazing time there and would love to go back!

Un havre de paix ! TOUT est parfait. De l'arrivée jusqu'au départ. Mika est un hôte de rêve. Il nous a donné rendez-vous au village de Sidi Bibi pour nous accompagner jusqu'à la maison. Une fois arrivés, il prend le temps de vous faire visiter la maison et vous expliquer les différentes activités dans la région. La maison dispose de 4 chambres indépendantes accessibles par la longue terrasse. L'emplacement est parfait. La maison dispose de tout ce dont on peut avoir besoin en vacances: jeux pour enfant, planches de surf, combinaisons, matériel de pêche, jeux de société  table de ping pong ... Le séjour était parfait. Si vous réfléchissez encore, n'hésitez pas ! Merci pour tout , nous reviendrons !!

Micah‘s place is as beautiful as the pictures make it out to be. The beach is remote and beautiful, and the house is sitting right on the sand almost. If you’re looking for solitude and quiet, this is your place. If you’re looking for nightlife, you’ll want to find that after you leave. Micah was incredibly friendly and helpful. He offered to meet us at the airport, and he was very patient waiting, while we struggled through getting a rental car, which took a while. I highly recommend having him pick you up at the airport, because the place is very rural, and taxi drivers. Don’t necessarily know how to find it. We asked for a couple of meals to be prepared for us, and they were wonderful. There is a caretaker close by who is Happy to help with anything you need. There is a small village in about 10 minutes away where you can buy water and basic groceries. I would highly recommend staying here, if you are looking for a place to unwind and relax. There is Wi-Fi,  but resist and unplug!

description.summary:
Maison de plage lumineuse dont une partie est creusée dans la roche à la manière des pêcheurs locaux depuis de temps immémoriaux. 

Le patio central, lieu de réunion et de partage, distribue en enfilade côté Nord 3 vastes suites (et une chambre) disposant chacune d’une salle de bain/toilettes & d’une vue plongeante sur l’océan.
Côté Sud, il donne sur un grand salon avec cheminée & d'une salle à manger-cuisine. 
Enfin, un pittoresque accès à la grande plage de sable fin. 
Un bijou dans son écrin!
description.space:
La propriété avoisine les 300 m2 en plein pied. Elle dispose de tout le confort moderne sans renier son atout premier, la symbiose avec les éléments. 
La plage souvent déserte, laisse libre cours à la méditation & à la contemplation. La petite brise marine matinale, le coucher de soleil plongeant juste en face, l’environnement saint, sûr et captivant parachèvent le tableau. 

Les planches (Longboard, Bodyboard, Skimboard) ainsi que les ballons, cages, freesbie, boules de pétanques & table de Ping-Pong sont à disposition également.

Possibilité de bénéficier des services de nounous & d'une "Dada", cuisinière qui vous préparera de délicieux pains & plats marocains.
Pour parfaire votre communion avec la nature, vous aurez egalement la possibilité de faire appel (en supplément)  à notre prof de Yoga ou aux services de notre pêcheur local aguerri avec tout le matériel fourni (Cannes à pêche, lampes frontales, tridents à soles & crochets à poulpes).

On n’a que rarement l’occasion dans une existence de vivre dans un environnement si particulier.
description.access:
Logement entier à votre disposition.
- les 3 suites avec salle de bain privative + la chambre 4
- le salon-cheminée, la salle à manger et la cuisine
- le Patio intérieur
- la terrasse de 38m de longueur, Tafarnout en terre cuite (four au bois d’Arganier).
L'accès privé & immédiat à la plage.

Chaque partie de la propriété, sobre et accueillante, est un lieu inspirant la quiétude et le bien être.
description.notes:
Les prix incluent :
- Vaisselle, casseroles,  poêles et ustensiles de cuisine.
- Tajines, Barbecue & grill.
- Les consommations d'eau, électricité et gaz.
- Papier Alu, Papier Sulfurisé, film étirable, Sopalin, mouchoirs et papier hygiénique, torchons & sacs poubelle. 
- Sucre, sel, épices.
- Eponges, liquide vaisselle. 
- Le linge de maison (draps de lit, housses de couette, couettes, taies d'oreillers, draps, serviettes de bain, lavettes, tapis de bain).
- Une bouteille d'eau minérale par chambre, le jour d'arrivée.
- Une boite de 10 capsules Nespresso (Volutto).
- Jeux de plage pour enfants
- Jeux de société (Scrabble, Monopoly, Uno, Trivial Poursuit, puissance 4)
- 1 paquet de Masques COVID normes Pharma.
- Chaise haute pour bébé.
- Niche pour toutou, jeux & Ecuelle.
-  L'accès internet en Wi Fi.
- les petits bois de Thuya  (cheminée).
- Un sac de charbon de bois pour barbecues, cheminée et Tafarnout.
- Allumes-feu
- Assistance du service technique en cas de besoin.
- Stationnement sécurisé et gratuit toute la durée du séjour.


Ne sont pas compris dans ce prix :
- les taxes de séjours : 31 DH par personne de plus de 12 ans 
- les repas et boissons
- le matériel de pêche & appâts. 


En option :
Il est possible de disposer d'un chauffeur pour les transferts de l'aéroport, faire les courses ou vous accompagner dans vos excursions.
Possibilité transfert VIP Aeroport (51 km) ou Agadir en Range Rover Sport tte options & intérieur cuir. (120€ =1300 dirhams)
Il est également possible de disposer des services d'une Nounou & cuisinière préparant des petits plats marocains. 


Possibilité de vous faire livrer par le pecheur directement au cabanon. sars, marbrés, Soles,daurades, loups bar, sardines selon la marée. Materiel de pêche disponible pour attraper les poulpes de nuit dans la petite crique voisine. Expérience unique.
description.neighborhood:
Au coeur de la Reserve naturelle de Souss Massa. Depuis la maison, vous y verrez passer toute la journée Ibis Chauves, messanges bleues, cormorans, hirondelles, canards sauvages & flamands roses. un spectacle dans un paysage de fin du monde.  
Néant absolu. Au dos, la montagne et la plaine. Face à vous se déroule l’océan. Bel hôtel « Ksar Massa » à 2 km au Sud pour tout ce qui est massages & spa. Petit resto « Chez Maxims » sur le sable de Tifnite à 5 km au Nord. Et quelques maisons de pêcheurs et de passionnés face à l’Ocean.
Spot tres prisé pour la pêche (à la canne ou dans les rochers à 200m).
Possibilité de s'initier au surf ou au parapente.
description.transit: Accès en voiture. Aucun problème de stationnement.
description.interaction:
Natif de la région, je suis dispo à tout moment pour vous aider, conseiller, orienter et vous renseigner sur les curiosités alentours.
La "cueillette" des tellines à marée basse (pour l'apéro), la pêche, l'astronomie & le lancer de freesbie n'auront plus de secret pour vous!
description.house_rules:
- Conformément à la réglementation marocaine, nos hôtes devront s'enregistrer auprès du gardien mr Abdil qui assure la gestion de notre villa,  ET parallèlement en envoyant par e-mail  une pièce d'identité pour chacun des occupants & un scan pdf du contrat de mariage pour les marocains ou couples mixtes au moment de la reservation.
Nous n'acceptons pas les couples marocains ou couples mixtes non mariés ni munis de leur acte de mariage & serons intransigeants sur ce point. Nous n'hésiterons pas un instant à refuser l'accès et faire intervenir l'autorité.

- Dépôt d'une caution, soit sous forme d'empreinte de carte bancaire (non débitée) ou soit par un dépôt en cash d'un montant de 5 000 DH (500 €)
- Le nombre d'occupants de la villa devra être identique à celui indiqué lors de la réservation, dans la cas contraire il sera établit un ajustement de facturation.
- Les baignades en mer ne font l'objet d'aucune surveillance.
Nos hôtes  dégagent le propriétaire de toute responsabilité en cas d'accident.

- Les animaux (chiens, chats) sont  autorisés.
