Hot tub, bar, changing area & outdoor firepit
Heated showers at hot tub and sauna area

hosts.about: Write the book you want to read, build the place you want to visit. My passion is creating spaces for people to enjoy.

recent.comments: Super Unterkunft für 1-2 Nächte. Wenn man auf der Suche nach etwas außergewöhnlichen ist, eignet sich diese Unterkunft wunderbar. Sehr zu empfehlen.

items.comments: Super Unterkunft für 1-2 Nächte. Wenn man auf der Suche nach etwas außergewöhnlichen ist, eignet sich diese Unterkunft wunderbar. Sehr zu empfehlen.

Could not say enough about this glamping site, it is fabulous. We stayed in the hobbit house and it's truly magical walking through the round door, you feel like you are transported to a different place. We only live 30mins away but it was so amazing to be there and feel like we were in a different world.
The toilets and showers were so clean, the kitchen and open dining area were very neat and tidy, plenty of store cupboard staples should you need anything.
Each house unique in it's own rite. Well lit up at night and very secure and safe feeling when you are there.
Could not recommend this enough, we will definitely be back and will definitely be telling others about it.
Loved the experience and Stephen was so helpful prior to our arrival, clear instructions and great communication.

The hobbit house was spacious and comfy. We liked the commitment to themes all over the Mayo Glamping. There was no toilet or sink in the hobbit house but the toilet and shower block was really clean and fully equipped.

To say this place is magical does not do it justice. I still can’t believe someone was able to think and build such a creative space. We stayed in the Hobbit house which was spacious and clean. We met folks staying in the A frames and Harry Potter house which were just as amazing as ours. We cooked our own pizza, sat on “the throne,” and took in the peaceful scenery. The only downsides were dogs barking at the house up the hill and no towels (all other linens were provided, and perhaps towels could have been but no one was there when I needed to shower in the morning and I didn’t want to call and disrupt them). That said, I will be back, ideally with my entire extended family to book the whole village! Oh, and Sarah, the hostess with the mostest, hustled to make sure everything was just right. She was so sweet! I love this place and you will too!

The Hobbit Hut was beyond amazing! Pictures are not enough to show how nice the place was. we were really like in middle earth, in a small safe sanctuary. The place is very clean and spot on. It was very nice experience and very unique.  Will definitely recommend!

We had a fabulous weekend away! This place is a must to visit. So peaceful and absolutely beautiful. The details put into each area is amazing and so well thought out. Stephen was so helpful and responsive to our messages. Everything was flawless! Lovely to meet Sarah and Jerry also. They were extremely friendly and helpful. The hot tub was amazing and the whole place was spotless! Thank you so much
The time in the Hobbit House was amazing...such a lovely place and Stephen was a nice Host. Thank you!

description.summary: Escape to a magical wonderland nested within the rolling hills of central Mayo. Enjoy a pizza from the wood fired oven, fire up the BBQ, toast some marshmallows over a fire pit, relax and unwind in our sauna and hot tub. With a variety of novelty accommodation to choose from such as a hobbit hut, Nordic wooden cabin or a railway carriage.
description.space: 2 night minimum stay on weekends. the hobbit hut has a TV which works via chromecast
description.access:
WiFi is available in Hall and Hot tub/ Bar area 

** Hot tub is for Adults only, There is 1 hour slots available from 5pm to 10pm There is a sub charge of €20 per hut per hour slot. times can be booked in advanced or on the day.

To use the pizza oven we supply timber. We Have pizzas on our shop for €9 each. you can bring a premade pizza or make your own. 
Movie hall works via chromecast, download the  home app to operate from your device. 

Kitchen area is open all night, tea, coffee, cereals are available.

There is a toilet located near the huts and there is 2 shower and toilet blocks on site

we do not sell alcohol on site,  BYO policy :)

hosts.about: Whether it’s a couples’ retreat, a weekend away with friends or an important family event, Waterfall Caves caters for every occasion. Our accommodation comprises underground caves with a hot tub, wooden chalets and a traditional cottage to rest and relax. Enjoy stunning panoramic views of the captivating mountains and countryside that surround Waterfall Caves.

recent.comments: Fantastic stay! Really loved the waterfall caves, jacuzzi and views were great! Buggy driving was a fun experience! Highly recommend. The receptionist was very helpful and made the experience all the better, providing tips for things to do and places to see.

items.comments: Fantastic stay! Really loved the waterfall caves, jacuzzi and views were great! Buggy driving was a fun experience! Highly recommend. The receptionist was very helpful and made the experience all the better, providing tips for things to do and places to see.

Stunning one of a kind experience. The grounds are beautiful and it was nice to see the donkeys, goats, sheep, and « April » the horse. I was so impressed with what Paula and her family built, with nature in mind. We stayed in the Oak room and it was perfectly comfortable and had everything we needed. We loved sitting in the hot tub in the rain, although most of our stay was sunny. Paula was so lovely and warm. We could’ve chatted for hours. I hope I can return in the future.

We had the best stay at the waterfall caves! The view from the room is of the fishing pond. My 8 year old was beyond excited to fish. We fished, rented the buggy (a 4wheeler RV type thing) and drove around the farm a few times! My kids did not want it to end! There was a playground on site as well! Ross and his sister were incredibly friendly at check in and they gave us incredible dinner and breakfast recommendations! The wave is a must for breakfast! Thank you so much we will be back for sure!
Really enjoyed our stay, Ross was so friendly and it was a relaxing place would definitely come back
Absolutely lovely location and the hosts were so friendly and helpful! Couldn’t recommend it more!

We had such a lovely stay at the Waterfall Caves and I would definitely go back, as well as recommending to friends and family. It was such a peaceful location and it was so beautiful. Despite the pouring rain we had a lovely, relaxing time and really enjoyed the hot tub and outdoor stove! They were so friendly too!!
Great stay was a lovely location with great facilities and a very nice host

description.summary:
Underground quirky accommodation on the shores of Duncrun Fishing Lakes. 
Private fishing lakes on location beside Binevenagh Mountain and forest. Walking trails from cottage with waterfalls and natural springs. Game of Thrones filming location within walking distance. Unique living space – one of a kind in Northern Ireland. Prime location on the Causeway Coastal Route, close to Giant’s Causeway, Bushmills Distillery, Benone Beach, Mussenden Temple, Hezlett House, Roe Valley Country Park.

recent.comments: A beautiful and unique stay. We very very comfortable, and the host did a great job to make sure we were happy. Nice touch delivering fresh bread for breakfast :) Happy to recommend to others and would return if we every travel in Portugal again!

items.comments: A beautiful and unique stay. We very very comfortable, and the host did a great job to make sure we were happy. Nice touch delivering fresh bread for breakfast :) Happy to recommend to others and would return if we every travel in Portugal again!

Had a wonderful 2 nights at this great apartment in amazing Monsanto. Comfortable bed.  It had everything you need for a short stay. Fresh bread in the morning and breakfast supplies were very good. Unique accommodation in a unique town.

It was hard to find the place.  The exact address isn't given.  We had to phone our hostess and she doesn't speak English.  The apartment could only be accessed by a steep climb carrying all your luggage.
The house is comfortable to spend a few days discovering Monsanto. Quite central and friendly neighbourhood.
Marta a été super gentille et avenante. Un logement parfait, très propre dans un lieu magique.
Le logement est dans le rocher et sur le site du Chateau. L’emplacement est exceptionnel et marta et jão sont adorables. Nous reviendrons !

My son and stayedhere forone night in March of 2023.  I so wish we had stayed2 nights.  Monsanto is a beautiful town that was one of the highlights of our trip to Portugal!  Thank you so much for a lovely stay.  I can'twait to come back

description.summary: Casa com 1 quarto, área de estar com “kitchenette”, WC com duche. Oferece diariamente limpeza e reabastecimento de produtos para o pequeno-almoço. Ar-condicionado, Aquecimento, acesso à “internet”, TV e área de estar. Cozinha equipada com loiça, (6 pax), talheres, cafeteira elétrica, micro-ondas, frigorífico com pequeno congelador, torradeira, placa e máquina de café.
description.house_rules: - Todas as crianças com menos de 3 anos são acomodadas sem custos adicionais por berço (capacidade máxima de berços no quarto:1)

location.address: Argyll and Bute Council, Scotland, United Kingdom

gallery.caption: Carsaig Cave, set under the edge of our small campground.
Front view showing outdoor seating area and our Argyll Kayaker Cove wardens, Cuan and Torsa. We accept pets but there is an additional charge.
Looking into the Cove from Cuan Sound, from the left, Mary Heather Lifeboat, Alexandra lifeboat, Kayakers shelter then Carsaig Cave.
Carsaig Cave , part of the facility’s we are providing at Argyll Kayaker Cove .The dedicated  parking is the right hand lower corner of this photo.
Galley kitchen, with fridge, microwave,double hob, toaster, kettle, George Foreman grill, cooking utensils , cutlery and crockery
Quadrant electric  shower, corner basin and W.C all set in a small room  with with sliding access door with the added luxury of  underfloor heating.
Single  bunks ( no linen provided)  upper bunk hinges down to make settee with table in main activity space. Shower and toilet are accessed through orange sliding door on left of this photo.

Double bunk set into the curves of the cave construction with skylight.
No linen provided, considering the current situation we encourage you to bring your own. However if requested we can provide a pillow,sleeping bag with liner & towel for £7/pp

hosts.about: A joiner and building contractor, working in the local area for 40years. Married to Caroline, head teacher in a Oban primary school, we have brought up 4 children in the area ,in 2020 the eldest was 25 and the youngest 18, some of whom help us run the facilities here at Cuan. Along with ourselves they realise how special this area is with its wildlife and ever changing environment. We hope you appreciate it also

recent.comments:
We stayed here with our kids aged 8,6 and 2. The location is absolutely stunning, peaceful and unspoilt. Great base for kayaking (spotted lots of seals!), beachcombing, fishing. The kids loved exploring the natural environment and spotting wildlife. Loads to see and do in the surrounding area. 
The cave is compact but with very well equipped kitchenette, warm shower and wc, everything you need.
With 3 kids we did wimp out of going completely ‘off grid’ so got an EE SIM which had usable 4G reception, could download films etc.
We had excellent detailed directions and local info from our hosts.
Highly recommend and we would love to return. 
We divided our holiday between the two caves, this review applies equally to both.

items.comments:
We stayed here with our kids aged 8,6 and 2. The location is absolutely stunning, peaceful and unspoilt. Great base for kayaking (spotted lots of seals!), beachcombing, fishing. The kids loved exploring the natural environment and spotting wildlife. Loads to see and do in the surrounding area. 
The cave is compact but with very well equipped kitchenette, warm shower and wc, everything you need.
With 3 kids we did wimp out of going completely ‘off grid’ so got an EE SIM which had usable 4G reception, could download films etc.
We had excellent detailed directions and local info from our hosts.
Highly recommend and we would love to return. 
We divided our holiday between the two caves, this review applies equally to both.

Brilliant stay on Slate Islands.
The area is stunning, the cave was very clean, comfortable and well equipped plus dog friendly, which is what I was looking for.
The little fire pit outside and wood provided by hosts was a great bonus for cooking some lovely local seafood.
Great communication from host as well!
Would definitely book again.
Thank you 😊
Wonderful place to stay. Such a peaceful and Beautiful spot. The cave was perfect for our stay. Warm, cosy well equipped and comfortable.
The cave house was excellent,perfect size for 2 and the dog. The grounds of Michael,s place was very peaceful ,wee shop not to far away. Would recommend it and hope to return and do it again

What a beautiful, cosy, idilic, rustic and creative space. 
The place was well heated and had everything we needed for a cosy holiday there. 
We did a fantastic coastal walk in the area, kayaked and enjoyed drinks at the local pub.
I would highly recommend it :)
This is a beautiful place to stay. 'Caves' were very comfortable and warm (it was below zero outside and we were still toasty warm). Cooking facilities in the cave are very good.
Perfect spot to stay for kayakers. Carsaig cave is lovely for 2 or 3 people, clean, cosy, nice view, decent cooking facilities, and ensuite shower and loo.

description.summary: Carsaig Cave at Cuan is set on the shores of Cuan Sound, it is the ideal location for kayakers, walkers and those wishing to enjoy the peaceful surroundings. Carsaig Cave, along with Cuan Cave, Alexandra Lifeboat, Mary Heather Lifeboat, Cuan Bunkroom and small campground  are part of the facilities we provide here on  Argyll's rugged coastline.
description.space:
Carsaig cave gives you the unique opportunity to stay in a cave, set under the ground at the edge of the campground, with all facilities to hand. Formed into the curved shapes are a double berth sleeping area and a double bunk that can be changed to a settee with table in the entrance/ activity area, all with views down the bay to the sea, or the stars at night through the roof lights.
We do not provide any linen, and due to the current circumstances, we encourage guests to provide their own. However, if requested we can provide a pillow, sleeping bag with liner and a towel for £7/person for 2 nights.
The galley kitchen has breakfast bar with stools, plenty storage space with cooking and eating utensils. There is a fridge, double hob, microwave, kettle, toaster and George Foreman grill, (or equivalent ). Set in the back of the cave, accessed through a sliding door is a quadrant corner shower, wash basin and W.C with the luxury of underfloor heating.
There is also an outdoor seating area with fire pit and wood available.
description.notes: Hopefully from the site photos and information you realise  that we do not provide linen or towels, considering the current situation we would encourage you to bring your own , however we can supply a sleeping bag with liner, pillow and a towel for an additional charge of £7/p for two nights if requested.
description.neighborhood:
Carsaig Cave is situated  at the head of the bay on the edge of Cuan Sound and is part of our Argyll Kayaker Cove, along with Alexandra Lifeboat, Mary Heather Lifeboat, Cuan Bunkroom and small campground  forming part of the facilities we provide here for accommodation. There is   access to the rugged Argyllshire coastline with stunning views and opportunities for exploration. As a designated marine area of scientific interest, there is an abundance of wildlife and nature to be enjoyed, from seals and dolphins to otters and sea eagles!

Cuan Sound is a tidal stretch between the Islands of Luing and Seil which connects two very unique island communities, both of which are incredibly vibrant and welcoming, and offer a range of different activities. The Island of Luing - the home of the famous Luing cattle breed and slate quarries "which roofed the world"- is only a short ferry ride away and hosts the  Atlantic islands Centre, a cafe and museum full of stories and history of the surrounding islands!  ( opening may be restricted due to current C19 restrictions)This is a perfect base to take a boat trip, cycle ride around the Island of Luing, or walk round the shoreline, if you are not a kayaker yourself! There are also a variety of lovely pubs and cafes in the area if you fancy a more relaxed  excursion.
description.transit: The nearest local town is Oban which is a 25 minute car journey from Cuan Ferry, or alternatively there is a regularly scheduled bus service operated by west coast motors throughout the day,but not on a Sunday. Cuan is part of the Isle of Seil, which is connected to the mainland by Clachan bridge or "the bridge over the Atlantic". Oban is well connected by rail and bus links from Glasgow and is also the major ferry terminal for access to the inner and outer Hebrides.
description.interaction: We live in Cuan House, just up the track from the bay. We like to give our guests space to enjoy the peace and tranquillity of the area but are on hand to answer any questions or provide advice on things to do and see locally if requested.
description.house_rules:
Please be mindful of the fact that the cave is part of the campground set in tranquil surroundings. 
Although we accept pets we have now had a number of guests that  abused this situation and the facilities so we hope you can understand why we now charge extra for the additional cleaning £5/night / pet.
